oExxDKyEDwsT0HaE9NcUQA.text: This place has to be the best find off the strip in Las Vegas. Great food and entertainment at neighborhood prices. Very quaint and cozy atmosphere. This was the first time there, we were a party of 4 and truly enjoyed everything. Mike and Laura are wonderful hosts. The staff was great. You must make this one of your stops when visiting and if you live here at least a once or twice a week. We are definitely coming back.

XKQzcJdVUXhew_9nGws7Jg.text: Had Thanksgiving dinner here today.  My Mother's House Italian Restaurant tried to kill us! Overloaded on excellent food, great wine, fabulous company and cannoli ~ if gluttony is evidence of thankfulness, we are the epitome of thankful!  Excellent food and service as usual.  Thank you Chefs Mike and Laura!

0dGnmqVjuPjZhM0p40vFmA.text: This place is a rare find in Vegas. The food was excellent and authentic and homeade. The  atmosphere equally great. Mike was a gracious and enthusiastic host.

qeHqS6gKpqpsi2ToYVPQtw.text: Warm, friendly place.  Very reminiscent of old Las Vegas.  The food was excellent, and the serving sizes were ample.  Live music available on the night we went there.  Drinks, entrees, and desserts came to around $35 per person.  I thought the was very reasonable.

dCacyJwufd8B15oUW_twQA.text: We are here from San Jose ca for a visit and our friends recommend this restaurant, OMG the best Italian food I've ever eaten. Can't wait to come back for more !!!!!!

sT5pjIKeuAWJe3ehQ-xqNg.text: This new place was so good! The service and owners were so warm and friendly! I will definitely be back!!

vWfSbJ9mPDlt9a85dShNDg.text: Fabulous experience. My cousins, Helen and Roger, took us here for dinner. The entertainment was a wonderful blast from the past, with super talented musicians and lead singer (sorry, I didn't get everyone's names, but since we will be moving to the area soon, we hope to get to know the whole gang). Chef Michael is a wonderful host, as is his wife, Chef Laura. And, as a special treat, Michael takes the stage croons old standards to our hearts content. You would think the place has been there forever -- the entire staff are as relaxed and lively as they would be if this was truly their mothers' house. Then the food! Oh, my, the food! My husband and I had a delicious lasagna. My cousins shared the awesome Frutti di Mare -- fruit of the sea, indeed. Another cousin enjoyed his Chicken Piccata and his wife said the Chicken Marbella was great. Two days later we went in at lunchtime for a milkshake. But when we got a look at the pizza being served at a neighboring table, we had to have one, too! Made with fresh and delicious ingredients, it goes down as the best pizza we've ever had. Can't wait to go back for more! Oh, and the shake was yummy, too! Don't miss this one folks! Tons of fun and fabulous food.

MSOhr7iBwmIQSAGAQkXobQ.text: I've been here twice and have highly recommended it to others. Everything I've ordered is served hot and very favorable. Mike and Laura are so welcoming. Great to have a fun local restaurant.

2FSH5sYCERd9AUmN-H7fcg.text: Awesome service and food! Great wine, although per glass is a little pricey the family meals are less than $10 per person! Only critical critique I have is the jazz music is contrary to the Italian theme. Should play more Sinatra or similar.

cUX_D9W3BV-xet8Eya5A3Q.text: Three men and two ladies went to MY MOTHER'S TABLE last night for dinner.  Chef Michael was making rounds at the tables.  We asked him what is a good choice for us five.  He suggested the ravioli with the sausages and meatballs.  It came with a salad and garlic bread.  It cost $29 for the family size.  What a deal and talk about good!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

hCddBkblkXMibjGm6jexjw.text: My Mother's House Italian Restaurant is excellent!  After a long week at a convention in Las Vegas, the service level offered here was a breath of fresh air.  My husband and I did not make a reservation (our fault) and walked into the restaurant on a Friday evening.  We entered into a live jazz dinner.  When we saw the tables were full, we slowly started backing towards the door to make our escape.  Laura (the owner) wasn't about to let a customer walk away hungry.  She waived us over and sat us out on the patio with a glass of wine.  She and her husband checked on us several times to make sure we were doing alright.  Once seated, we ordered the small family style portion of the baked rigatoni and the tiramisu.  Our entree could have easily fed 4 people.  Our server, Aunt Doris was very attentive and accommodating.  My Mother's House Italian Restaurant is a wonderful dining experience.  I recommend it for anyone who lives in Las Vegas or is visiting.

T1lI38y-BqVz6hpvW3kgKw.text: it is the beat food I have ever taste I will be back there the service  was the greatest  . me my wife enjoy  the food so much I will recommend  this place to everyone  I know

uyu6CShE_MRm4xJJQ5_E0A.text: This is a hidden gem of Italian food! Chef Mike is awesome!! He brought some Christmas magic to our kids at our table! His wife was just as sweet! The food is amazing and speaks for itself!! We had the fruitti de mare and lasagna. Both were wonderful! The fruitti de mare is hugggeeee! You definitely get your money's worth here. The complimentary garlic bread is so delicious! This restaurant really makes you feel at home. Will definitely be back for live band nights as I heard this is something we really should check out. Thank you chef Michael for your wonderful hospitality! We'll see you real soon!

OLWCk8Gdyds_JlNkbe4eSQ.text: I can't say enough about this place! From the food to the people to the atmosphere, hands down the best of the last mom & pop Italian restaurants in Vegas. Laura greeted us like we were guests in their home then Chef Mike insured our dishes were prepared perfectly to our liking. The live music set just the right tone for nice night out. Ask for Aunt Cheryl if you want genuine hospitality and impeccable service! The value is unheard of when you see the portion sizes and quality of the food. We will eat like kings for the next couple of days with leftovers. I can't wait to go back to our new regular neighborhood spot!

l-lgR_avP5MGgtNIY8AURQ.text: Chef Mike and the team are absolutely fabulous!! You truly feel like family. If I could give 10 stars I would. Some of the best Italian food in the city. Definitely going back again and again!!

IJwRnexeW4VwTdxQGzdA3A.text: Loved the FAMILY feeling.  My grandchildren were brought up front with the band to dance and make memories.  They went home with a full belly, a big sucker and even enjoyed free ice cream from Chef Mike. We really enjoyed the heart of Vegas still alive and tasing so Good.  Make it happen...

pfPNCltUwUO0uMGB-t7mAA.text: Born and raised in Vegas and very spoiled!  5 restaurants all the time. Not easily impressed.  My Mother's House is the first time in so so long that I have been very impressed with the food and ambience. The family owned and run restaurant is refreshing and inviting. I highly recommend checking this place out. Local or tourist looking for a great spot. Call ahead for reservation for sure.

SEdmH5BTAUBO8imZtA1KLA.text: Wow, thank you Yelp!  Found this absolutely amazing place here.  The owners and staff make you feel like your old family friends, the chef visited our table and helped us pick the perfect entrees for dinner, my daughter got the blue claw crab with angel hair pasta and I opted for a chicken dish. Both were out of this world - ambience made us feel like we were on Mulberry Street!  What a find!

eJo6bawtZrQuGAiDzoOqaQ.text: Three things I LOVE about this place:  1) Chef's Laura and Michael greet and welcome you. I mean really open up and make you feel like you are part of the family (maybe distant cousin).  2) over all service; we were lucky enough to get Brittni  (Laura's granddaughter). She was knowledgeable, friendly and prompt.  3) Food was great. My wife had a chicken special (Franks Chicken) Wow, zesty spicy and just simply Delicious. I had the lasagna, also great. The finale was the cannoli; I eat this in every Italian restaurant that we visit and theirs was fantastic.   All the above will tell you that we will be regular guests at "My Mother's House".

Xyp2kekJpegCbEbL0DnySA.text: I would definitely go for the Retro Entertainment, not for the food, at least what I had Spaghetti & Sausage , had to be the worst I have had, they say the Seafood is the best..I would be a little nervous about that. But that's me.  A 5 Star Foodie.. No one came to my table, other than the waitress , she did not ask, this is my opinion, she did say it was a new cook, not a problem, was not looking to get a free meal, Just wanted you to know, so you could improve .

rFc1y8TsKqB1gAVWSKIIxA.text: Went for my birthday with the family. The owner is an amazing host and the service was so attentive. Can't say enough about the food. Everything was good! My mother just kept saying all night that she wants to come back.

ixwV_H4yZGnB7PMpZx7cXQ.text: UPDATE: I decided to change my star rating after reading the owner's comments to my review. Clearly, they don't need the business, at least not my business. She takes an interesting approach to customer reviews.  Let me start by saying that this place has the potential to be great. Very old Vegas, goomba kind of environment - not Italian, but rather East Coast American-Italian style. To start with, the owner, who answered the phone, wanted my credit card number to make a reservation. I declined (because I don't want my hand-written credit card number laying around) and I offered to bring him cash to place a reservation. The owner relented and made the reservation. Fifteen minutes later I was off the phone, but this was due to the friendliness of the owner. Always, it seems, the entertainer. I enjoyed the reservation chat once we got past the credit card issue.  Our food was quite good with the salad and garlic bread being excellent. Two of us loved our dishes and the others said theirs were ok. The entertainment is a plus, which might help explain the high prices. We were ok with that, as the entertainment was fun, although it was way too loud. So loud that we had to write our orders on the paper table covering to place it with our server and we could not have conversation until the band took a break.  Now comes the check. Again, prices are high, but we attributed that to a way to help pay for the entertainment - no problem. Soon, the server came back to our table and told us she had to amend our check because she forgot to add the entertainment fee! What? There was no mention of any entertainment fee when I made the reservation, there is no sign posted about this, and there is no info on the website about it. And after being open for a year, you 'forget' to add the entertainment fee. Expressing our dismay to the server went no where so we paid the bill and left.  To the owner, I hope that seemingly arbitrary, unannounced and surprising entertainment fee, as well as the extra loud music continues to work for you. For us, we won't be back. Regardless of how good the food might be or how fun the entertainment might be, the prices are too high considering the added entertainment fee and the music is way too loud.

Xk37FUK5u0Wv4d0T3MoL3g.text: So many things to say about the place. Even though it felt like we were driving to Utah, it was worth it. 1. Owner, Chef Mike is worth the trip.  2. Atmosphere, old school Vegas. 3. Aunt Cheryl, our server was awesome. 4. The food.....omgeeee!  5. Garlic bread is better than... 6. You have to get dessert! 7. Go there, now.

Chef Mike and Laura and staff are very friendly and entertaining.   We didn't get to see the show but we will definitely be back.  Remember to make your reservation.  P.S. sorry didn't get pictures of desserts but yum!

oN3KwhlqYsHAZFXY70-jAw.text: This is a great a great place to spend a great evening.  There is no rush to get you out.  The table is reserved for you for the entire evening.  The food is great and the service is the best.  Our server was very attentive to our needs and wants.  We never had to ask for a drink refill.  He was always on top of that.  Not only great food but Chef Michael and Laura were friendly and visited with everyone.  Then, Chef Michael and the band entertained us for about two hours.  We will return and we will tell folks how great they are.  If you go, you had better make reservations.

s7PLLVpRchbArYLEsI9neQ.text: When one dines, they want excellent cuisine, great entertainment if available and great service. What I enjoyed about this restaurant is that it brought back memories of the old days of vintage Vegas. The host Michael Leonetti, who also does a fine job on those Loui Prima songs, greets all his guest. But that's not all, his recipes for his grandmother to his own are super good. Chef Michael cooks with his heart and the people love it. thanks for a great evening of Italian cuisine, great ambiance and entertainment.

zsv4c0RoJyff_VXFT73xJw.text: Went here to celebrate the life of a friend who had passed and what a great experience!!  Upon arrival you could tell this place stood out. The decor and the greeting by the owner and his wife were unmatched in any dining experience I have had in Las Vegas. The live band was setting up and the place was getting busy around 5:30 pm.   After being seated we got to chat with the owner (who also serves as a stand up comedian/singer/greeter/waiter/etc). His wife was just as great and they as well as all the servers were spectacular. We started with a complementary antipasto and garlic bread. My wife and daughter ordered the house Cab, my Dad a beer, and his wife a moscato and away we went.  Upon hearing of the specialties from the owner I was set on the Frutti De Mar. It was huge--like 3 people to finish huge and leftovers. Mussels, clams, jumbo shrimp, and a lb of spaghetti in a rich gravy. Delish  My Dad and his wife had the ribeye. Marinated for 5 days and you could cut it with a butter knife.   My wife got the chicken marsala and loved it.   Food was all top notch, they brought cannolis home for dessert, i was too stuffed.   We were a party of 6 and a 14 month old. The atmosphere was fun. There was dancing, singing, laughs, and even our granddaughter had a blast which is not always the case. The lighting and music kept her entertained as it did for us.    Do yourself a favor and check this place out!!

lDglVDjdfs3J-C9NJrPX5w.text: Oh My God!  This place is like being back home. I'm Originally from NY/NJ the salad and the gravy was like my mother's.  Best sausages I've had in my life(my wife agrees). Meatballs were perfect.  With that also came Rigatoni bolognese and eggplant Parm all for under $40. We also ordered the Shrimp Cocktail and Lasagna (there were no bites left). Last but not least the owner Chef Mike was gracious and one of the best hosts you can ask for. I mentioned I heard the pizza was great. He told the kitchen to make a bunch of pies and brought it out for the whole restaurant. I did forget to mention he SINGS. And boy is he good.  What's even better his band was phenomenal.  They played all the Italian songs I grew up on.  End of this story is that I will be a regular.

PzAGq1ebBvBhPIQcTVikWw.text: This old school Vegas supper club was such a treat! The music was great. Professional and very talented musicians and singers! The owner was very pleasant and visited all the tables. You must have a reservation and what's cool is you're not made to feel like you have to hurry up and leave. He said you are here for the show and dinner and take your time! The food was excellent and the portions are very generous! Highly recommended! Enjoy!

Q6PhEw_fCJ9it7EQ4vOv3A.text: First time here! Came in with my mom and daughter. We had reservations, which I highly recommend you make. We were greeted by Laura and Mike graciously and seated promptly.  Aunt Cheryl was our server for the evening and she was delightful! Mike made sure to come say hi to us at our table. He informed us of the specials which we decided to order. Chicken Neapolitan with fried zucchini and a side of pasta. Delish! So tender the bone just fell out. My daughter ordered the orange roughy with a lemon caper sauce I believe was created in heaven. My mom had the linguine and meatballs. Another delish dish!  For dessert we had the one with cream puffs and the other, the limoncello (forgive me I forgot the names) But holy moly!... Incredible! The entire time we were enjoying these delightful morsels, we were being entertained by Mike and his band. Such talent and charisma! A glimpse of old Vegas lounges. So happy my daughter was able to experience it! Just before we were leaving, there was a large party that was also departing. I had flashbacks of my childhood being at my grandparents house when the whole family was there. They were all standing around having different conversations as they were saying their goodbyes. Truly a blessing to witness.

94nw2qsXreDN5DH5D52XeA.text: Listen you wanna have a fun laid back time with great food? If so then this is the place!!!!

fiiZJI6PF-9BdRM2KPaBsw.text: This place is a great secret gem! Dinner and entertainment like Vegas use to be! We were there for almost 3 hours and enjoyed every moment. No rush to eat and leave. Its truly like being at your mother's house. Aunt Cheryl was amazing as our server and Mike and Laura are the best hosts into their "home".  We can't wait to go back and share the experience with friends and family. Stupefanente!

sAjvl3zG4XnbR_oIXUW68g.text: Food was very good except the salad. Salad dressing was almost nonexistent. It was very bland except for the onions. Our pasta was very tasty but only warm. We had a party of 11. They are very accommodating with respect to splitting check. There were 3 of us and we ordered a large family size; more than enough foods. Chef Michael is very entertaining. The group was fine. They weren't so loud you can't talk. Overall, we had a great time. We will go back.

qFtQcqKJJdeMSzOkTAsfdA.text: Hands down the best Italian food I've ever had. I know that's a bold statement but with the food, atmosphere and the customer service it takes the cake!! Chef Mike and his amazing wife Laura were fantastic! It's a must go! You literally get treated like family not a customer!!

xv--jPP70LCS_Rx0yDO1pQ.text: This is one of the best Italian places I've had in Vegas! We came with friends and family and tried several items off the menu. Everything was delicious, especially the meatballs and ravioli. We brought our 15 month old son, and the owner brought him a lollipop and ice cream sundae. We were treated like family. The live music was amazing and our baby loved the songs. We will be back again for sure!

Ax_FA0Tw1P2YWc41BUT8Tg.text: this is by far the best restaurant i have been to in las vegas. the food is mouth watering delicious even when your full you still keep eating because it's that good. the staff is so awesome they make you feel welcomed and have the best personality. you really feel like your at home getting love from everybody. and let's not forget the great entertainment they had the whole restaurant enteracting as if we knew each other. great vibes. awesome band.  chef mike and luara make you feel like family along with the great staff they have. definetly recommended for a great night. you won't be dissapointed. will definetly be going back even considering catering. keep up the great work mike and laura.!!

m1rEi_TUTtgXxcUS1mIxGA.text: Our first stop when visiting Vegas is My Mothers Italian for the great food, atmosphere, music and people.  The eggplant Parmesan was crispy and the meatballs moist and flavorful.  Thanks for welcoming us into our family!

e5zLdbl0v5BZomI8A3wvqA.text: What a great place to eat but the extra special treat is the music.  Trio is great and singing is better then anything on the strip.  Michael is the great entertainer like days gone past.  Can't wait to go back

Bfok6w7yDu6kSklQwAAY7A.text: Location: very good, easy parking, close to Summerlin main roads, availability of outdoor seating Service: very good; Scott was professional and attentive, without being cloying Entree Value: good considering a large quantity of food for the price Food: horrible garlic bread and horrible salad, fair to poor antipasto, rock hard cannoli shell with institutional filling, adequate if lukewarm apparently reheated entree and good wine Other: others may well find him charming, but we found the owner/chef really creepy.  Oh, and a fork was dirty, but replaced when requested.  It will likely do fine in Sun City with inexpensive dinners starting at 4:00, so they won't miss us when we don't return

ACfXA97tk5QXM3GZig1KSQ.text: Went there last night and was blown away! We arrived at 8pm and sat down right away. I read reviews beforehand saying that once you walk in you feel like part of the family, and it was True! Cheryl was our waitress and was the sweetest woman. The owner came over and shook our hand and introduced himself. The salad was so simple but extremely delicious. I had the chicken piccata and it was excellent, my boyfriend had the lasagna and it was wonderful as well. They also give you generous pours of wine. They had a band there playing old rat pack songs and it seemed like a party in there and I loved it. At one point all the waiters started dancing with guests. It was a great experience. My boyfriend and I agreed that that's going to be our date night place! The only criticism I'd have was that at points it was a little too loud, we waited quite a bit for our food since it was so busy (although the entertainment kept us occupied), and the bread they give seemed old. Definitely going back though!

8EcoADl8FxFuDxhh8NNI0g.text: After reading some other reviews on here, I wasn't sure what to expect but went in with an open mind. Had a great night. There're trying to create something different that you won't get in a regular restaurant. No corporate feel. No foo-foo exotic dishes that you regret ordering. No foodie snob appeal. Just real (delicious) Italian food like grandma made. This is where I want to go to have a great meal and to laugh with family and friends. Where the staff and owners want you to feel comfortable and enjoy yourself. No, this isn't the place to go for a quiet romantic dinner. It is someplace I'm going back to.

RZlApYDqPpwzsAhbIXo-Rg.text: This was our first visit and will not be the last.  What an amazing dining experience.   The food was delicious and the smells from the kitchen made the experience even better.  We listened to live music, of the Rat Pack era. The owners were so hospitable.   Michael has an amazing singing voice and made our evening a romantic outing.

3ttJcuK0fuM9oCzlESgTMg.text: This quaint Italian restaurant is to die for.  Chef Michael and Laura were so amazing they'll make you feel like family.  The food is divine. Highly recommended is the fruitti de mare. If you are a seafood fanatic like me, it's a must try.  I will definitely recommend this place to everybody. Simply amazing!

stuEiT5lkQ4f6GSKmzOFBg.text: Went here as a large group of all ages. We felt like we were part of the family. Food was excellent. The entertainment was that of old Vegas....Frank Sinatra, etc. The children danced and sang and were given lollipops and ice cream. Great wine selection too. A wonderful, memorable and delicious night. Thank you!!! A truly special place.

Smtx2NVb6Bnj8Mf-qRfh1A.text: We love it here! The bolognese is really something special here, has that home made long cooked taste, so good. Portions are perfect, garlic bread is yummy and always fresh. Prices are down right cheap, and you can't beat the atmosphere. We love coming here with our son and the owner always makes sure to stop by and say hello (he makes sure my son gets a nice scoop of ice cream to top off the meal.) Love it!

qw0z7FOGshoaNV5TTDXg6Q.text: We just took out dessert- tiramisu and cannoli. SO delicious! Perfect consistency and texture. The staff and the owners were so friendly and accommodating. Both owners came up to see how we were doing and to make sure we were being taken care of. We will definitely be back to enjoy a meal. Forgot to take a pic of desserts- they were gobbled up so quickly!

NaoDIlL_0TqDyTmzWKKFjw.text: The most pleasant dining experience I have had in years.  My wife and I heard about the place having good food so we decided to give it a try. Upon pulling up in the parking lot we noticed a man in a nice suit standing outside of the restaurant and we immediately thought we were under-dressed wearing a button up shirt with jeans but as we got closer the man welcomed us and introduced himself as Chef Michael (the owner) and escorted us in.  Once we were seated, the charismatic Chef Michael took the time to explain the different special offerings he had for the guests and made suggestions.  He informed the waitress of our desires and went off to mingle among the other guests.  We also were able to let ourselves off the hook as far as dress code as the diners were mostly casually dressed  The inside of the restaurant was cozy and we felt at ease.  There was a piano player offering music for extra ambiance and then came along a person with a snare drum to set up..then a base player and hey, all of a sudden you had a 60's cocktail lounge setting going and soon thereafter, Chef Michael gets up and asks if he can sing a song...I mean, it's his place, so sure - why not?  My wife and I were surprised on how fantastic he performed the song not only with a great voice but a ton of energy as he sang a song from My Fair Lady...  Now, I must say, my wife and I were the youngest in the place at this time of day (6:00 pmish) and despite being the youngins of the crowd, we were probably having the most fun out of everyone there!  It felt like you were at a place the Rat Pack would have hung out in.  The food was great as well with large portions and I blame Chef Michael for that second batch of garlic bread he had brought to us for not being able to finish my meal.  Overall, this place was the most enjoyable eating experience I have had in years.  I totally loved it and will be back!

zLNxeeL-oXecptesA1t5Iw.text: Unfortunately, I'll never eat here again. Extremely disappointed because I enjoyed the food and prices were reasonable. I had no problem with the service until I witnessed the owner yell at an employee that he would send her "back to the plantation" if she didn't hurry up and answer the phone. As we all know, these are sensitive times. A comment like that is never ok, especially in a workplace environment and the service industry! I was completely shocked! Up to that point, the owner seemed presentable and welcoming. I wish all of the employees the best. But I would NEVER go back and I would NEVER refer this place to anybody!

NRHXMwUedQflYHcgmafr3A.text: This place is awesome! I thought I was gonna get wacked a few times... LOL Kidding but it's one of the most authentic looking places I've ever seen! Great food and ambiance, will certainly go back again and again...

WqNVlbjI3DRqA8mWjikXdA.text: WOW! Just WOW! Dinner last night with friends for my birthday and they could not have chosen a better place! The owner was so entertaining and cute, the band was phenomenal, the food was the best Italian in Las Vegas, and the staff was unbelievable! I had lasagna (I always rate an Italian restaurant based on their Lasagna) and it didn't disappoint! Best lasagna ever! Thank you to everyone in the restaurant that made this an unforgettable evening!

xwK9J0_r8kjgJhNCJbfr9A.text: We had a wonderful time last night....the meatballs and brisket are to die for.   Will return soon...also great value....food and entertainment at a reasonable price.

iiksNOs_NuXPuDiFlSwv2Q.text: We absolutely loved our meal at My Mother's House. It's the best authentic Italian food that we've ever had. The service was also exceptional. From the moment we walked in the door Laura & Michael greeted us and ensured that we were well taken care of. Michael goes out of his way to exceed his customers expectations. He not only is the owner and chef, but he is a wonderful entertainer as well. We will definitely be back. We have already recommended My Mother's House to several of our friends and co-workers.

6ku-iVBIGobzfJSlT2wSmA.text: Great food! Great entertainment for all ages! Love this place! Mike and his staff are 1st class!

iW8wgnMvj9IYdrY2qdfpbw.text: New to Vegas My Daughter wanted Italian food This place has a very heart warming feel the moment you walk in. If your looking for a place to feel welcome My Mothers House is a must Thank you for the great home town feels

lvQdwNpPimrUY3ZN1FUh0A.text: This was an absolute wonderful unique family dinner experience. I was a bit skeptical at first when they were so accommodating to our large group of 18 ppl at such short notice. We were seated promptly upon arrival in a large U-shaped table, and was overwhelmed by all the visual stimulation from Christmas decorations/lights to a grand piano to an oversized rat pack wall art. Chef Mike greeted us and made us feel at home with his humor and hospitality. He was very comfortable in interacting with the kids in our party. He even offered a recliner/rocker to my youngest daughter who had just woken up from a nap. He was constantly engaged with the whole room cracking jokes and even sang part of a song or two. We ordered family style with several dishes to share including seafood combination with red and white sauce. I found the clams to be my favorite shellfish in this dish. I also recommend the chicken ala Sinatra which was also juicy and tasty. I also decided to try their Italian beer -'peroni! Crisp and refreshing. Their desserts were definitely a must try. The tiramisu was light and creamy, and their lemon dessert in a flute was absolutely refreshing and yummy. I would go back even just for their desserts. Our whole group had a great memorable dinner thanks to chef mike and his great staff. Hope to see you again chef mike!

w-SXNxPsbGF1_QIT9inkzw.text: OMG this place is awesome and I already have plans to come back! Went to dinner on a Wednesday night with my boss. From reading the reviews, I was nervous that this place may be inappropriate for a party of 2 since the food was family style- I was also nervous about the noise level since some previous reviewers commented on it being too loud.  I can tell you, I am SO glad I picked this place for my boss and I. We came in around 6:20pm during the first set and we were seated. There were breaks in between sets where you can converse with each other/the waiter/entertainers. During the set, all you will want to do is watch. Trust me- you can see the passion in the musicians eyes. It's just such a great experience that you rarely get nowadays. Immerse yourself in it. Anyone into music, good soul, excellent jazz, a lil swing, should come here and check it out.   Now the food-- again, I was nervous that this place wouldn't be appropriate for 2 due to large portion size-- however my boss and I shared a small family plate and it was exactly the amount of food I'd want (with a lil to take home- and trust me, you WILL want to take a little back home)! Portions are large but the small shareable platters are perfect for a party of 2-so don't let a small party or a date night detour you from this place! The food is spectacular- which I kind of expected from reading previous reviews. I have no clue what the reviews re: food being salty is about. I've had good Italian, bad Italian, and meh Italian- this is good Italian. I believe we stayed till about 8:45-9. This was a bit longer than I thought I'd be staying but we were having a good time listening to the entertainment. There were parties/people that left earlier between sets, so it is not mandated that you stay- however your table is reserved for the night. Noise level- I was literally sitting right in front and yes, it was loud, but not "this sucks" it's so loud. It's a "this is so cool, these guys are legit performers" loud. If you are coming here - come on and come for the experience!  To the people who complained about the entertainment fee... really?! I thought the fee was too low and put more money in the tip jar. Btw - There is no pressure to tip the entertainers. I believe I read a review saying that if you sat in the front, you felt like you had to tip... Well- I sat front and center and felt odd tipping when I did lol. You actually have to go out of your way and walk to the front, up to the stage, to tip the entertainers- so to anyone who may feel like you will be pressured to tip the entertainment-- fear not, though you really should cause the entertainment fee is too low. I'm guessing it's that low because anyone who hasn't gone there would be scared to even try it if the entertainment fee was more- who knows. Maybe it's because it's kinda a bit of a trek to get to?   Tip: it's in a sort of shopping plaza and my GPS sure had me going some weird way getting to the place (lots of side streets/residential)--however getting back home was super easy so maybe it was my gps.

Aa-NLkE-2yzpt3Qc_hSMww.text: First I want to say that this is my first time to this restaurant. Many people have recommended it and they were spot on that this was an amazing restaurant not only for his food but for the atmosphere and the entertainment. I actually felt like we were in a family home enjoying a meal. The owners were so open and receptive and made you feel like you were part of their family.  Michael and Laura are the ultimate hosts.  I'm Italian so I think I have a very good pallet for discerning excellent Italian food. This was five star all the way. The atmosphere was fun and I smiled so much my cheeks hurt when I left the place. There is no place else like it in town!  Come hungry because there is plenty of food and it was some of the best Italian food I have had in a long time. Large portions and highest quality ingredients. Certainly will be back.  Thank you Michael and Laura for a fabulous evening.

iPT_C0KGW299Y4w3RrVRJw.text: I gotta tell you, I am totally trilled with Chef Mike and Chef Laura's Italian restaurant. iH-EDjz1aGbXfl7genhSPA.text: We had dinner here for the first time tonight and everything about this place was fabulous! The food, the music, the service and the family feel. This place fills up fast so make your reservations well in advance.  The owners came by several times to talk and check on us. We had the ravioli with meatballs and sausages and couldn't have been more impressed with how great it was.  Then there is the entertainment, Chef Michael and the band blew the roof off the joint!!! bKSNxYpAvNN9NNdwZXGH2Q.text: If I could give My Mother's House more stars, I would. This is the coziest, authentic, family oriented Italian spot in town. On certain nights, they have a live band, and owner Chef Mike Leonetti gets down and does a lot of the Sinatra based entertainment himself. He and his wife Chef Laura made us feel very at home since the moment we walked in the door. They go from table to table greeting everyone and making everyone feel so welcome. Chef Mike also makes sure every kid gets ice cream! And he gave little pea a huge lollipop when he came over to say hello. This is, by far, one of the friendliest places we have ever been to. Food and service are amazing! Our server Dylan was so great! Get you some real Italian food and come here to enjoy a family-style meal one day! Children are welcome and very well loved. We are originally from New York and this is by far, the most "at home" place there is. Thank you, Chef Mike, Chef Laura, and Dylan for an amazing first visit. We will definitely be back and have already been spreading the word. Bless your warm hearts!

6PE_g8A8GJWkO8kncNwGYw.text: Really enjoyed this place!  Great food, fun atmosphere. Reservations only, as they don't turn tables. Pricey, but portions are huge.

bc1uig1V7WQqi11wsCs4OA.text: After seeing the reviews on Yelp, I was dying to try this place. It's not horribly far from home and I was craving some real Italian food.  The location is in the middle of a strip mall in Sun City, Summerlin, and it was packed, surprisingly so for a Wednesday night. I was glad we had reservations, otherwise we might easily have had to wait a long time for a table.   The restaurant isn't huge but you wouldn't know it from the noise level. The conversational din was pretty high, but could easily be attributed to the high age range of the customers. I've been told that hearing aids aren't a perfect solution for most people and I think the average age of the clientele was north of 70.  Our waitress, Angie, was a doll! She brought lots of free goodies to our table, which everyone gets - antipasto, garlic bread slices, bread sticks, and salad. None were epic but all were good.   Hubby ordered the steak, which comes with the claim that they don't give you a steak knife because it can be cut with a butter knife - and they weren't lying. I had a taste and it was tender and tasty, definitely an Italian marinade that's worth having. I wouldn't want that for every steak but yes, it was pretty damn good. Hubby did a good job finishing up every last bite of that steak and it was a good size.  I had to try their lasagna, made from the owner's mother's recipe. Initially, I liked it pretty well but then I realized that I wasn't a big fan of the lasagna itself but liked the outer parts where I could include the marinara from the serving plate. The actual lasagna wasn't made with marinara included and was a bit too heavy on ricotta for my tastes. If you love ricotta, you're going to love this lasagna! The portion was huge, and the leftovers were enough for two more meals at home.  We didn't order any of the family meals, which are served on platters. Any one of those would have given me leftovers for a week!  Now, about the band and the singing... There's good and bad about it. The good is that they're all dang good, and the owner has a great singing voice! You have to like the RatPack vibe or you'll hate this, but it would be hard not to be converted by them. The bad was the volume. It was so loud, I felt like my brain was melting. I have sensitive hearing but I felt like I might need hearing aids myself after sitting through a 3-singer session. The other 2 singers were good, one is a younger crooner who is the son of their amazing guitarist and the other was a visitor who they said is retired from a career at the Met. She sang all her songs in French, so I had no idea what she was singing.  They have their live music sessions on Wednesday, Friday, and Saturday. As much as I liked them, my hearing insists that our next visit is likely to be on a Tuesday or Thursday .   Overall, the food is pretty good, the staff is amazing, the music is loud but good, and we'll be returning before long.  Oh, and the owner (and Chef) is absolutely adorable and might stay and chat for a while, and expect a hug from him when you're leaving. He's definitely a people person and is charming as heck.

sAegHSngO8hQ2blDBOh45g.text: As a vacationer and first time visit to this establishment, I was not impressed. After reading the reviews their was several warnings and I thought not to judge to soon and give this place a try. The previous reviews held True and thus my experience fell short. However if you are an elderly couple or family visiting you may have a wonderful time.  But as a younger couple the interaction of the chef is off putting and found to be to obnoxious.  In response to Laura, you don't have to explain or defend your establishment. I only post reviews to give my opinion that way other yelp user can have the best experience! However I fell short on my review by not talking up your food.   So in a not so apologetic way... the food is supreme but bring a big appetite or make sure to have enough people to share the meal.  Each meal/ food option can feed 2-3. So you will get your money's worth.  And at the end of the meal you get a fancy gift bag with a few cookies.  And if your lucky enough the piano keys will be played loud enough to make you feel like Sinatra is right in your ear.

fi6Oam6XYIHQsax9zKTGhA.text: Absolutely, hands down a terrific experience! We had a couple of friends and we wanted to find a hole in the wall that was kid friendly and viola! The ambiance, the music, the food, the servers, the owners.. everything was absolute perfection. The owner "Mike" was so generous with our kido ( free Lolipop - Santa called it in, Spaghetti & Ice Cream.. its Christmas! ). The flavor was so unique and not like any other restaurant we ever tried before, this was the best hole in the wall experience we have ever had here in Vegas.. hands down!

H0eJsOnMJ4K9sjT0hGsQdQ.text: I've eaten here several times now.  The food is very good to excellent.  Portions are large (some main dishes serves 2 or 3).  Food not a spicy as many Italian dishes are in other restaurants.  Atmosphere is good.  About the only negative is the that the music is too loud for the space.  The piano playing is over bearing, although the quality is great.  Make reservations.

mLH924G9DZ0NggDANgavgQ.text: We had been talking about trying this place for some time now and sure are happy we finally did. It was such an amazing experience! From the moment we walked in, we felt like we were part of the family. There was live music (piano player) and the food was incredible. We started with the garlic bread and marinara, to die for! Then we had shrimp scampi and lasagna (best we've ever had!). Since it was our first time, they brought us a cannoli, again, simply delicious! We are already talking about when we will be back and who we have to bring with us. This spot is an absolute gem!!!

wcmf5rRFXRHV--Yo9DyKzw.text: There aren't enough words to describe how amazing this place is. Everything from the food to the hospitality! Very authentic Italian and we feel like part of the family. Great food, great wine, great people. Can't wait to come back! Be sure to say hi to Chef Mike. LOVE THIS PLACE

NwTOU5sVERP6PiSyHb2QBQ.text: This is by far the best Italian restaurant I've ever been. Delicious food and great ambience. Will definitely go back there for more.

cn2y3KNiw27itijAz2iGyQ.text: Best Italian food in Vegas! Their restaurant has such a great feel and everyone is so kind! Feels like you're eating with family. Highly recommend!

snbYDXJKcAwWvuEX04W4Rw.text: Service is amazing, owners are very personable. Food is delicious. Little hole in the wall treasure. Karey was our waitress and she was very patient and helpful.

7L6NSWXKuZBqeUjXgty9vQ.text: An adorable couple, an amazing meal and wonderful entertainment.  This was our first time but it will definitely not be our last. We shared the meal and have enough for lunch tomorrow. There was so much pasta and seafood that they dumped our shell bowl three times while eating it. You will not believe the shrimp!  Chef Michael welcomed us, made food recommendations, got on stage and sang a few songs, played the drums and even told a few jokes. His wife Linda was beautiful and kind. Tonight's meal was what Vegas was built on. Great food and great people. Keri served us and she was very nice and a wonderful server. We started a list of people we want to take with us next time! Wonderful meal!

J4to2dseeqr9UKS_HDeXnQ.text: Warm and welcoming atmosphere. We loved our experience. The food was spectacular and the music was wonderful! Chef Michael sounds like Tony Bennett! Our new favorite place.

k1607P7pQI3oPfx4Bfzw8w.text: Delicious home made Italian food and a great friendly atmosphere! Fuggedaboutit! Everything is made in house and the service is outstanding.

5-cQfbCr8LaMS91ca70GlA.text: If I could give this place 10 stars, I would. OMG, the best place in the world to eat dinner with your family. We stumbled upon this place on Yelp, made reservations for myself, my daughter and the grandkids, ages 1, 11, 14 and 17. When you go inside the place is light blue decor and white table cloths. There is Sinatra memorabilia all over the walls, like at your grandma's house! The staff are amazing and accommodating and get you taken care of right away. Everything is family style, which is really fitting because when you are there, YOU ARE FAMILY! So, we are there hanging out when Chef Mike, the owner comes to the table and sees all the kids. He picks up his phone saying,'ring ring' and calls Santa, and he is told to give the kids suckers! Not little Lollypops, but giant woven suckers like at Disneyland! He talks to the kids and goes about his business. His wife comes to the table,she runs the floor, and asked to hold the 1 year old and takes him for a walk around the restaurant (she said all her kids are grown up and don't visit, lol) He loved her! Next, Kim takes our order, by the way, she is super awesome! So while we are sitting there Chef Mike goes up on this little stage with full band and starts singing. Now, he was a singer in Vegas way back in the day and has the most amazing stories he tells before each song, Franky, Deano, Sammy, he knew them all. AMAZING performance while you are eating, the best!!!!! The food is amazing AND you get a lot of it. Pasta, salad, meatballs, eggplant Parm, ravioli, and more! And you get a show. And not just a show, you become part of it. Mike took the girls on stage and they became his back up singers and dancers. Listen, kids these days have different tastes in music, but when the band played they felt the nostalgia and went nuts for it. My 17 year old granddaughter said, 'that's it, I'm. Moving in here and Chef Mike is now my new Grandfather', lol. Myself and the kids highly recommend you and your family come and spend an evening with Chef Mike, his wife and the whole staff. It will be an evening you will talk about for years. Thanks, Chef Mike!!!!

JiWlajoVjuPlzE9287bQWg.text: First time trying this place. I absolutely loved the environment, the staff was very polite and excellent service. Everyone from the owner to the waitstaff was great. The food was excellent. My favorite part was the live entertainment. It was an awesome experience. We will definitely be back time and time again. Thanks  for a wonderful evening.

8a41uafOHiW3MrivByR_cg.text: The portions are huge! The meat sauce is excellent and kind of comes on most things that have a red sauce base.   They have a few specials each night which are worth knowing about.  Make sure to ask about them.  Make sure to try the St. Anthony's cup for dessert. The chocolate they use in it is outstanding!  You won't be disappointed of you go there.

GO0y3p9FySsNElB7msn_sA.text: AMBIANCE This place was extremely gaudy and we absolutely loved it. It has the intentional feel of eating in your Italian grandmothers dining room mixed with a rat pack nostalgia. It was awesome.   FOOD  The food tasted homemade and was homemade. While I've tasted better Italian food, the fact that this food was made from what was clearly a family recipe made it have that heartwarming home cooked feel.   SERVICE The owner, Chef Mike was ridiculously entertaining. He spent a large amount of time sharing great stories w/ the guests and was hilarious. The staff and owners were very generous as they handed out oversized lollipops to the children in the restaurant and went above and beyond.   PRICE The food was about $10-$15 higher per dish then typical mom and pop Italian restaurants, but holy smokes do you get the quantity to match the cost. The portions are GIGANTIC!  OVERALL This was a great experience for all of us and was great to visit.   COMING BACK? We WILL be back with our family and kiddos. :-)

O8ZBrV-O_Ccb8N3Q-8naFQ.text: Wow! Who knew places like this still existed. You know how restaurants say"just like moms cooking" but it isn't True. Well this place it is True. Everything is so fresh and you would swear you are eating at home. From the garlic bread with bolognese as an appetizer to the dessert at the end everything was delicious. The desserts are amazing I couldn't decide so we had two! My first time here but I found my new favorite Italian restaurant. Mike is the real deal, old school Vegas with the class and charm of another time. They make you feel at home as soon as you walk in. I live close but I would drive across town to eat here, it is just that good.

photos.caption: Photo of My Mother's House Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iZov-sZaO_m09bdqQ3vYcg.text: I love this place! The food is awesome and the atmosphere is like home. Authentic Italian and like homemade! The Owner came to our table and introduced himself. He was so cute! He let us know that he makes the food himself fresh daily and lovingly went over all the ingredients he puts into it. Right after he was done talking with us he jumped on stage and sang us a song! It was great! Will definitely be back!

d6D9nVH_SBrqwNtNkZvc3A.text: We arrived 45 min before closing and they still pleasantly sat us. Our waiter Uncle Sal was very attentive and kind. We started out with the crab cake appetizer. The crab cakes were delightful! They were not heavy with breading, nor greasy and they had the perfect amount of stuffing.Chef Mike and his wife were always making the rounds of their guests and checking in to make sure everything was to their satisfactory. They are very sweet, pleasant people. We asked Chef Mike what he recommended and he said the brisket. His words exactly,"Brisket so tender, you could cut it with a spoon. You cant cut it with a spoon, then you dont pay for it." Well he got us curious, so my boyfriend ordered the brisket. I asked him what another favorite dish was and he said the orange roughy. Never had it and I'm always up to try new foods so I ordered it. They brought out homemade garlic bread sticks with their own bolognese sauce.  Yum! Chunks of garlic and great herb seasonings. The salad was perfectly tossed with the right amount of dressing. Very light and refreshing! Our main courses came out a little while after and wow! Chef Mike was right that brisket was so tender you could cut it with a spoon! It was heavenly!! The orange roughy(white fish) was so succulent and light. The sauce it came with was very good. It was the perfect pair! Shortly after we ordered dessert. Mama's homemade rice pudding. It was soooooo good! I was already stuffed from the main course but I wasn't going to let that go to waste so I found some way to eat all of it. Hahaha. No regrets! Chef Mike was so kind to even put it on the house for us. Overall the atmosphere the experience was fun and friendly. I recommend this place to anyone looking to get away from the Italian chain restaurant because this place makes you feel like your family and they truly care for there guests. Thank you again!!

TQ7MZ76yibVyjZt1q97ZRg.text: Horrible dining experience. The band was so loud that we could not have a conversation. The service was bad and so was the food. Bad lounge show with bad food. Would rate zero stars if I could. The owners response to my review shows how much they care about how bad the service was. The waiter spilled the sauce on my husband's silverware when he bought out the bread. Removed the silverware and never replaced it. They got his order wrong so the food came out late. We had to refill our own wine and ask for refills of soda. The staff didn't even notice that two of us barely touched the horrible fish. They need to advertise as a lounge act that serves food

pxKxyLGn5eb2agOP919KJg.text: Excellent crab cakes and the linguine and mussels were terrific! I topped it off with equally terrific Tiramisu and Cappuccino. Great meal overall! I want to say this place has very friendly wait staff and Kudos to Aunt Cheryl for awesome selection

9F_VbuJq2CPuN74M737XDA.text: This restaurant/lounge is absolutely, hands-down my favorite place we went on vacation. The food was FABULOUS. The band played on the night we came (we had no idea that was part of it) and it was the best part!!! Chef Mike and Laura are so personable and treat you just like family! Cheryl was so sweet and took such good care of us! The main courses were great, but the desserts were to DIE for!! I could not speak more highly of this place if I tried. It is absolutely a great find and we are so thankful we found it! Worth the 20 minute drive from the strip!

YOQBjD6ZbD7SDwRyJ7u3fA.text: What a nice surprise! Truly a hidden gem. I saw the owners on Fox 5 yesterday morning at the same time my husband was asking me where I wanted to go for my birthday. Sounded good, so he and I, along with another couple who are our dear friends, made the trek from Henderson. Excellent food, I guarantee the biggest portions you have ever had! Often you get a big plate but the food is "meh". Not here! Everyone starts out with a  beautiful salad, French service style. Simple, fresh and delicious. I had some of the best lasagne ever, one friend had the Fettuccine Alfredo. Excellent. Hubby ordered linguine and meatballs, good but the sauce had cooked a little too long, a little brown, slightly bitter. Which was odd because the lasagne sauce was a similar sauce but sweet and good. They certainly don't stint on the cheese - eveything was abondanza! Deserts all excellent, we each order a different one and then pass them around. Lemoncello dessert was "roll your eyes back in your head" great, excellent FRESH cheesecake, great canneloni and very good creme puff slathered in chocolate. We went on a Friday, and - who knew - it becomes a supperclub and show starring the chef who used to tour with the old Vegas greats, on Wed, Fri & Saturday. A 5-man live band - and the show just came with dinner. It was like going to a Italian wedding, lots of interactive stuff, especially showcasing any kids in the audience, making it memorable for everyone!  No more expensive than the Olive Garden, and if you haven't picked up on it yet: worlds apart! Great place to bring out of town guests or for a special occasion.  GO! You will LOVE it!

dZjwC8vAPp5eUC5RMI5Tkw.text: Italian! Italian! Italian!  Great, unbelievable tasty food! Awesome service!  Made me fill like I'm home... Mike.... I believe he is owner! Was around all the time, making sure everyone is good! Had nice quick conversation... Good personally person!  Servers are well known what they are doing!  Definitely will come back!  Highly recommend!

dgQucLSZkvs6QFpQTkG7Cg.text: I don't have enough words to describe how great this restaurant is. The feel of the place is so authentic and brings you to a different time, a simpler time. Everything in his restaurant has meaning and is intentional. Now let's talk about the food!!!! It is simply amazing, everything is handmade and fresh, the owner mike came out to speak to us and even chose our meal for us and it was superb. We came here for my bachelorette party and they were the sweetest beings on earth. Not to mention mikes great voice, he sang a song for me to wish me luck in my marriage. It's was not just a dinner, it was an experience. Thank you mike and uncle Dylan for making sure we had an amazing meal!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of My Mother's House Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FvT0f7aXwsjBRgE4z7ac4w.text: Was looking for a good Italian place to come for my birthday and this did not disappoint. Definitely the best in Vegas!!! We came in right when they opened at 3:30 for lunch and they had 1 table open that wasn't reserved for the evening, so be sure to make a reservation. The service was great and Chef Mike and our waitress treated us amazing all evening. The food was even better than the service and nothing disappointed. Very authentic and fresh. Every thing that was upsold met expectations and a few family style meals worked perfect for our party of 6. We got the Sea Food Special and the Ravioli and both were great. Definetly recommend coming here, especially if you're a Vegas local.

YjOqg3fcDg25Bz5Pg-gfKA.text: Michael and Laura, thank you again for such a wonderful night. The food, friendship and music is always so perfect. We enjoy spending time at your restaurant and it is like being welcomed into a home full of life and love. Thank you spending time with us at the end of our evening. Thank you for sharing your stories and look forward to seeing you both soon.

hy6obpU8U_VlAAIYzYBqeA.text: Fanstasic family restaurant. Come on the nights they have music for the best experience! The owners are so gracious and they go out of their way to make you feel welcome.

g4AWtU28cQONURwAYp7jCg.text: Fabulous night and experience. We felt wanted and welcome as we were greeted by the owners and had a hand written reserved sign on our table with our names inscribed.  The restaurant has a strolling violinist and guitar player who play for requests. We were seated next to a large group of young adults touring in a Shakespeare theater group. When the strolling musicians visited their table everyone sang and their voices were glorious. They sang the theme song from Cats in therefore part harmony. What a nice piece of free entertainment.  Our food was delicious, orange roughy piccata for me and brisket for my husband.  During dessert the musicians were at the table across from us on the other side and a woman at the table began singing an operetta piece. Voice of an angel. Wow. Ended the evening with complimentary tiramasu. Perfect, delicious, exciting date night for two.

ZUFKcndpCAC-pa0k9eJ2kw.text: Have been wanting to try My Mother's House since we moved to Vegas a couple of months ago. Last night we finally got the opportunity and boy was it worth the wait! Mike and Laura are amazing, the food incredible, and the show outstanding! I felt like I was back at my grandma's house having Sunday dinner. I had the brisket which was so tender you could cut it with a spoon, and my husband had the linguine and clams - huge portions and so delicious!!  Thanks Mike and Laura for an awesome evening... We look forward to being regulars and will be back soon!

Kfaxh7zxsH40DQDlVLvCqg.text: This is probably the best restaurant I have ever been to. The service here is top 5, they treated us like family. Bringing my father here on Father's Day, was such an astounding experience for him my sister and I. Everything about this place was welcoming such as the owner, his wife, the waiters, and even the musicians. There is no family owned place such as this one, you leave this place feeling elated. I will 100% love to come back to this place again.

gzDTMhylEQqIKRjibwwFfQ.text: To a RACIST, TRUMP SUPPORTING RESTAURANT I'LL NEVER GO BACK. My wife and I were sitting by the kitchen counter nearby a big party, all African Americans, and REPEATEDLY, I heard the staff referring to them as N*****!!!!! How can they be in the restoration business and be okay having their staff use the N word so freely??? All chatting about how they won't tip, 'be careful if they pull a stunt and leave without paying' etc. and one of the owners was standing right there not caring at all about fixing all this racist talk! Oh, and most shockingly to our eyes, since we're Hispanic immigrants, those people had the guts to have this idiot walking around tables like he was some sort of celebrity because he looked like Donald Trump. Newsflash, nothing to be proud of! It made us very uncomfortable!

qHfd20bmYAAtUKyF4d9MbA.text: This is my new favorite Italian restaurant in Vegas. For the True Supper House experience with friendy staff, and a terrific live band lead by Chef Mike, the owner. A New York feel with down to Earth fun for all. Service by uncle Dylan was fantastic.  Can't wait to visit again.

HLCADi4Tt8hpjSNLLh3zoA.text: Such a pleasant, friendly and delicious place! After my son's graduation ceremony, my family and those in town for the event were treated to the best of atmosphere, service and Italian cuisine that I could have asked for. And I did! I had contacted Chefs Laura and Mike and spoken with Cheryl a couple of months in advance to set the date, and they were all so helpful and accommodating. From having the cake delivered and delivering the little flower arrangements beforehand to deciding what to do for the menu--they were all very patient and professional. There were twenty of us on the afternoon of the graduation, and we all enjoyed the our time there and happily left with our leftovers. I am looking forward to bringing my buddy from New York when she is in town back to My Mother's House to enjoy the supper club they also feature here. I am sure it will be just as enjoyable!

tPo9dEwWqpSvVZ83c4kToQ.text: This is my first ever negative review on Yelp, but I feel it's really necessary. I went here this evening with a large group of coworkers, it was my husband and I's first time. The ambiance and the lounge music is entertaining and quirky, and the staff was really nice. However we sat down at 6 PM and our food did not come until 8 PM. My husband and I split a plate of gnocchi. The portions were generous but the quality was absolutely appalling for the prices (we paid 47 dollars for 1 split plate, 2 sodas, and the 5 dollar entertainment fee). The tomato sauce they use for almost every dish is salty, poorly seasoned, and reminded us of canned chili. The meatballs and sausage were poorly seasoned and heavily overcooked. It was the worst meal I have ever had in a restaurant in my entire life, without exaggeration. I'm so sorry to disparage any family owned restaurant, I really hope things improve.

hUDcMCsujbZdnQb-lDJwBg.text: This place is a breath of fresh air! Great food, great live music, friendly staff and the owner is very personable! He is such a character and makes the experience even better! We will be back for sure!

g3Xs8DJXL9QzsHe-d52cOg.text: My new favorite Italian restaurant!! Six of us went and the food is spectacular!! My husband had Lasagna,  I had 2 lbs of Mussels with Linguine. Had to take half of our meals home!!!!There were two other couples with us. Jim had Gnocchi. Sue had Chicken Marsala with Linguine, & Mike & Reta had Orange Roughy! Everyone was extremely  happy with their choices.Owner Michael is wonderful and our server Cheryl was a sheer delight!! Small intimate place with awesome atmosphere!!! Even got Italian cookies to take home!! Definitely  going back to try otherwonderful dishes!!!

bq4sQq7VjaptX9jR0BLujQ.text: Love love love fughettaboutit and try my mothers house. Its not just a restaurant. Its a destination. Its the warmest reception i have ever had and the food is top notch. You won't be disappointed .the tiramisu is the best i have ever had.

TeGq3jG7odKLzltSmAysMA.text: This is the first review I have ever written on yelp, but felt it would be unjust not to acknowledge such an amazing place. My girlfriend and I came her for a late valentines day dinner. And it wouldn't be an understatement to say she was so in love with the place I thought she may be asking the owner if she could live there at any moment. The owners and staff were incredibly friendly and made you feel like you were at a friends/family's house for dinner. The food was beautifully presented and full of flavor. The music added an excellent vibe to the place and the decorations were fantastic ( ranging from throwback pictures, different colored lights dancing on the ceiling, record albums, and other classic memorabilia. ) Looking forward to coming back and bringing family and friends.

iHw9nqZjqC3Glg4fcTsfKQ.text: My Mother's House is a wonderful example of old school, Italian, where everyone is family, restaurant. The owner greeted us at the door and was interactive and entertaining (we got an acoustic guitar serenade) throughout our meal. The salad was delicious, the garlic bread - more like a toast - was garlicky and buttery and the house made ravioli and meatballs and sausage, made with house made marinara was exquisite with perfectly cooked pasta. Wine is priced well. The owner had us try the limoncello, so tart and creamy, and the coconut gelato, to die for! We will ask for double malt next time in our malteds ( we like to be hit hard with malt), but will definitely be back. Looking forward to the nights they have live music... the owner plays the drums! Excellent meal!!

TwcXKAIbgOw77G4te5uMkg.text: I love this place best Italian food I've had in a long time! The atmosphere literally feels like you are eating with family! The owners are polite going table to table making sure everything was going well! Wait staff very attentive! I highly recommend the caprese salad it was easily the best one I've ever eaten!

zCCufUeuFkOrUqto9oeW0g.text: This place is amazing! Owner was incredible and entertaining. Had my Birthday event here and can't wait to return. Food was great. Just loved it!!!!

4Q06ctVq-FqaZntPqAKmZQ.text: When you want Italian food as close to what you make then this is the place to come.  We sampled a few dishes as they have Family Style as well as per order but the per order is enough for 2 to share.... Meatballs melt in your mouth the sauce is scrumptious.  You will have left overs so ask for a little extra sauce to take home.  Live music Wednesdays, Fridays, and Saturdays.  Great home feel and atmosphere.

2TNQo7tDIcOH6VrXFgP1XA.text: This is hands down the best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas and one of the best overall. From the beginning Chef Mike took care of us and explained literally everything about the place. From the menu to all the decor, he had a story for everything. We were there for the first time to celebrate my mother in laws birthday and once we told him that he brought a guitar, started singing and then came the complimentary cake. I tried a lot of different food and it was all so good. The pizza appetizer was delicious and probably the best pizza I've had. The desserts were really good too! I'm definitely gonna come back next time when they have the band there! They even gave us some to go cookies once they packed up all our leftovers. Also I forgot to mention the portions are huge so you should always have some leftovers.

L-qUUaD-xw_9LbC_XM9VoA.text: Fabulous food and exceptional service from our favorite Aunt Doris. You want a traditional Italian dinner with live music this is the place! Superb

FOitduTnvO884x9q16keHQ.text: Meh. It was ok. I had pasta with clams and I had to drain out all of the grease just to make it edible. Honestly I could have saved money and cooked a better meal at home. The music is super loud and you can barley hear yourself think. It's also a retirement restaurant. That's neither here nor there...but def will not be back.

RJ-PqHkVs5Durxv7i2Z3lQ.text: Been back twice since my first review a month ago and the impossible has happened... It's gotten better!

am6qYLqWV25G2aq9-4EibQ.text: The best meal and the best service we've had in Las Vegas since moving here in December. The owner is amazingly sweet checked on us, told us his family stories and comp'd dessert which was delicious. I'm a bit of a foodie and the gnocchi is the best I've ever tasted!

a-n8421VJlBI3bPI-nxYtw.text: My new favorite family spot. Feels like old Vegas (and I am a 3rd generation Native) so much food (leftovers for days) and served with love!!! Homemade ravioli, delicious! Generous pours on the wine too!

fMHoAHpZrZKxjOblJfy-nA.text: What a great restaurant! We have been searching for an Italian restaurant with homestyle cooking and a great atmosphere and this place exceeded our expectations. The staff treats you just like family, the food is just like I remember from family dinners growing up!!! There is even entertainment that beats the strip! The best thing is that this place is so kid friendly. The owners made my son feel like he was one of their own family. We will be back many many times!

NcG4xC1W89jvMOav7MP0Sg.text: Place is great. Entertaining for the whole family and large portions.  Chef Michael is great and greets each table making everyone feel special.

zZwWss5O-Vp6qQy0Z84Ezw.text: Another local gem! This little place shines like a pair red spit shined shoes. It has character and ambiance that is perfect for a romantic evening or casual time with friends. The food appears to be fairly authentic Italian fare. The lasagna and Chicken Marsala were excellent and are a fan favorite. The garlic bread will have you wanting to follow its roots to Italy- it's that tasty. The antipasto was also a nice touch that is included with your meal. There is piano music playing on the nights that the enchanting throwback to the oldies show isn't playing. The owner and staff provide exceptional service and will have you smiling from ear to ear before you leave. This place is a go in my book but don't forget to make reservations.

fr8BwIf9hBJh1W7WaVRQEQ.text: Best place n Sun City Food great entertainment great great night last night love the ambience chef Michael was fab

Q4WbXUNUKpX3pJOquz2PMw.text: My husband threw me a surprise 40th birthday party here. Man did they make it amazing. We had about 30 people there. Service was amazing. The entertainment was great - and most of all the food was to die for. You immediately feel as if you have known the owners forever. They literally treat you like family. In a town where you never get that feel, it was a wonderful experience that I will never forget. I didn't want the night to end. We will continue to recommend My Mothers House to friends and family going forward. Also if you are looking for larger parties, they will make it so amazing for your event and the pricing you can not beat!

kxv5ITbet5wvgpU5vlVM5g.text: Food was very bland and the service was very awkward! I've never had a waitress hover over my shoulder wile signing the check before.

ov05ZEUD4E_Cr_2YWDRM1w.text: It is embarrassing to find a new restaurant, give it a rave review, tell friends how great it is, take them there, and then have a bad experience.   I was not going to update this review, thinking we would just not go back. But last night I met up with another Yelper, an Elite who said she couldn't wait to go after reading my review. After telling her about our last experience, she urged me to write an update. And then when I came here to do that and read the one written by Simone R., the feelings it evoked were so similar that I know it's the right thing to do.  We went last Saturday, wanting to see the show that Chef Michael had talked up incessantly during our first visit. For starts, we could not have a conversation with our friends, because it was so loud. If that were the only bit of unpleasantness, I wouldn't be giving this place two stars. But then we ordered our food.  First came the salad, along with the garlic bread. The salad was so incredibly salty that it was inedible. Our waitress, Aunt Cheryl or Cousin Cheryl (it's all family, and confusing), said she'd re-do it and make it herself. It was better.  Our friend ordered Mussels Marinara. The presentation was spectacular at first - served in a huge, covered ceramic tureen. But she had a hard time getting the contents out, and even after that, getting the mussels out of their shell, because she wasn't provided with a seafood fork. She got one after asking for it, but still struggled with getting the food onto the plate.  I ordered Chicken Marsala, which I had a tiny taste of when my husband had it last time. Too bad I didn't have a bigger taste. First, it seemed that the overly thick sauce was thickened by a huge amount of pieces of batter. But even worse, it, too, was so salty that I couldn't eat it. When I sent it back, the only thing that was different was that the cook had simply omitted the capers. Yes, I know that capers are salty. But I'm perfectly capable of distinguishing the salty capers from the rest, and it still was oversalted.  None of this would be enough for me to downgrade this place to two stars, nor is one bad experience. But the coup de grace was the attitude, and that's where Simone's review becomes relevant: When we first arrived we were received like royalty. But at the end of our sorry dinner, Michael, making the rounds in his incessantly loud and self-promotional way, came over to ask how things were. I told him about the salad, the mussels, and the fact that my meal had to be sent back. His response? A mere shrug, and he walked away without apology. He couldn't care less, and wasn't going to do a thing about it. He didn't offer to comp the dish, my glass of wine, or even offer a dessert for the table to share. Not a damn thing. I am reminded of a certain politician who is your best friend when you are praising him, but you're worthless if you're not. It's not about free food. It's about feeling like a valued customer, and we felt we were treated badly.  IMO, this is not the way to treat a customer who has not only given you an outstanding review, but who has returned with other people in tow. The lack of caring speaks volumes. When it's good, it's good. When it's not, you're SOL. The emperor has no clothes, and this is not a way to run a business. We will not be going back.

kC-xXgphxsJZwAJ6LmKKXg.text: Went to My Mother's House a couple of weeks ago for the first time after hearing about the place and wanted to write a review. Making reservations was fairly easy, but that was the BEST part of the whole experience. If I could give a negative star rating, I would. As soon as we arrived and placed our drink order for 2 waters and 2 diet cokes, we were made to feel like we shouldn't be there if we are not drinking alcohol and watched the wait staff annouce to we assume the owner, that we were not drinking alchohol.  Our table was ignored and the time period in between a salad and entree was close to an hour and 10 minutes. When the entrees arrived and the calimari was a blackish/gray color and tasted pretty much as bad as it looked, I got up and walked out. Every entree looked and tasted like it was prepared with a microwave.  The brisket had packaged brown gravy smothered all over the meat that tasted like it had been cooked, frozen, thawed and reheated.  The chicken parm had the oddest taste to it that any of us could even explain. Nobody in our party of 4 ate their entrees, paid $130.00 for absolutely nothing, but we were just Happy to get out of there. 2 of the 4 people in the party were ill and could not leave their bathroom the next morning and had to stay home all day.  The atmosphere was so loud that you could not have a conversation with the person on the side of you, and we were on the opposite side of the room to where the entertainment was happening.  No earthly idea where the positive reviews come from, but I would never recommend this place to anyone and can see this showing up on aLas Vegas Dirty Dining episode in the near future.

Zq8HFPEpIfXkJjFgRjMIRA.text: A must go experience! Let's start with ambiance  Move on to food quality   Go to variety of beer and wine selection   Add character and atmosphere   Winner! Winner! Best Italian dinner!!  Chef Michael is all-in-one.  He brings his talent of making delectable food, originally under the tutelage of his grandmother, to your table.  His lovely wife, Chef Laura, gives him full-support, love, admiration, and I would bet a good bit of tolerance.  Our server, Kris, was on point, guiding us through each course, able to answer every question with a smile on her face and genuine care for our dining pleasure.  Everyone was considered family.   The first course was Chef Michael's personality.  He loves what he creates.  He lives and breathes it.  He gets excited just telling you about what he is going to serve you.  It started with crunchy delicious garlic bread, flavorful salad, and the best ever melt-in-your-mouth meatballs.   We decided to share two entrees this evening.  We had Blue Crab from Maryland with Angel Hair pasta and Marinara sauce, as well as Sauteed Orange Roughy with Zucchini. Both excellent!  We went with a Pinot Noir from Oregon, "Evolution", even though we were eating seafood.  It was actually a good choice.  Not heavy and complimented the meal.  Soft warm cloths with a slice of lemon were provided for clean-up.  Needed it as we made a delicious mess. (We were provided plastic crab bibs to protect our clothing.  How did they know we would be so messy?) Dessert?  Of course!  We chose two of the three special desserts to share for the evening.  Limoncello - so fresh.  If you've ever had the martini, this is it frozen.  I'm not going to share it next time.  And the cream puffs with St. Anthony's chocolate.  The "to die for" dessert.  There are 3 little cream puffs topped with chocolate from Italy that is nothing like the over- sweetened, candy-like, chocolate we're used to here in the U.S.  So yummy. You may even get a serenade by Chef Michael!  If the weather is right, sit outside.  Beautiful setting.  "Back in the day" tunes play while you're lost in the harmony of flavors you're experiencing.  Live entertainment is provided on Wednesday, Friday and Saturday.  I hear it's spectacular.  We've already got reservations for Friday night.  Looking forward to it!

c49Cvx7TC-uIM-SORcBWwQ.text: I had so much fun! Came here not knowing there was a band playing on Wednesday's, and I'm very glad I did. The service was excellent! Dave was amazing! FCYjEYDzGhaswVwxsRXrzw.text: What a wonderful dining experience for our whole family! They were able to accommodate our group of 15 on short notice. Our servers were so friendly and efficient and Chef Mike himself described all the dishes and made amazing recommendations. He was such a wonderful host and made our entire group feel right at home. He even sang a couple songs and entertained the entire room all night not just with his songs but his stories too. The food was simply delicious. We ordered family style which worked out great because we got to try a little bit of everything from their pizza, ravioli, their incredible seafood dish, the chicken piccata, and every single dessert on their menu which included the best tiramisu I've ever had, a wonderfully refreshing lemon dessert and a delicious cup with cream puffs covered in imported chocolate from Rome. We had a great time here and highly recommend them for a delicious and fun family dinner!

H4bm_ugt2l2IhNzHxyhxdg.text: First review of the year, so you know it's going to be a good one! Impressed, that's an understatement. The people of Sun City are a lucky bunch to have Mike and Laura in their neighborhood.  Oh, sorry, Mike and Laura are the owners, and the Chefs, oh and did I mention musicians too? By the end of the evening we nicknamed the gentleman Triple Threat.  First and foremost, be smart and make a reservation or there's a good chance you won't be dining here. It's a small and intimate place, with live music and some of the best Italian food I've had in a long time. They make a dish or two of each item per night and when they're out, that's that! They are so specific about their recipes and how things are prepared, I could see the passion as they spoke about it. Chef Mike explained in depth how the picatta is cooked, and how the chicken never actually touches the pan because he layers it in artichokes. By the way, it was one of the best picattas I've ever tasted. As soon as you sit down you're greeted with a complimentary house anti-pasta that's very delicious. And DO NOT, I repeat, DO NOT skip dessert!  We didn't feel rushed out at all, and they welcomed us to stay and enjoy the live band.  I will without a doubt be returning as often as possible to this restaurant. The food is to die for and prices are more than reasonable. They truly make you feel like family, and considering the name, I think that's the point.
