IRlXdPnnLFbPIb_ZQcWNIQ.text: The food, the atmosphere, the music...I can't say enough about this place. It's not just dinner; it's an experience. Old Las Vegas is still alive and well for those who miss it and those that missed it. Truly a fun night!

LOChfVHE9Q6HzjJ8g3Wwzg.text: Wow!!!! Every bite of food was truly incredible. My Mother's House Italian Restaurant made us feel so welcome just like part of the family.   Ambiance:  The classic sounds of Sinatra combined with the smell of incredible food fill the air when you step through the door. Place a reservation and sit down to a table that has your name on it. The server will come by and greet you with a friendly smile and welcome you to "My mother's house"  The owner actually came by our table to personally recommend some of his favorite dishes, we definitely felt special!  The food:  Words can't begin to describe how amazing the food was. The meatballs were so tender and the sauce was a perfect compliment of delicious flavor.  Linguine & Clams - Perfect alDante pasta covered with a lemon , garlic ad clams  created a memorable dish.   Chicken Piccata- Amazing tender chicken with artichoke,lemon and butter were combined to create this delightful dish.   Sicilian pizza - this pizza was one of the best pies I've ever tasted! I definitely recommend it to order the pizza.   Long story short you can't go wrong here. Anything you order is guaranteed to make you happy! We will absolutely be back very soon to try the rest of the menu.

vfexp7BvThbTbW00jp-uZg.text: Great food and atmosphere! It remind's me of old Vegas! Your taste buds will not be disappointed.

oHGlH4JHwjoYnrL90L3abQ.text: I'm in the food and beverage business so I judge way more harsh then most. It was phenomenal!!! Great food, fantastic atmosphere and the owners are soooooo adorable!!! Will definitely be back soon!!!

k682fm3intn_QvJ9305v4w.text: My large family (about 24 of us) went to 'My Mother's House' for Thanksgiving dinner, and it was such a treat!  I cannot say enough wonderful things about our experience- it is one we will all cherish for a long time.  A festive interior filled with Italian accoutrements and Christmas lights greeted us, along with a warm greeting from Chef Mike himself.  Wonderful servers kept our water glasses filled and our wine glasses fresh (with that nice Italian pour!) as we prepared for the FEAST!  A 7-course meal left us all so full yet it was so delicious none of us could stop eating.  Italian wedding soup, antipasto salad, amazing pastas, melt-in-your-mouth meatballs and Italian sausage... and then the traditional turkey and other Thanksgiving items...but let's not forget the delicious spumoni and to-die-for cannoli.  Wow.  I cannot wait to return to Vegas so I can enjoy another meal at My Mother's House, enjoy more delightful background piano music, hear tales from Chef Mike, and make this place part of our family's tradition.  We will be back!

04Ai7v7lJg4BFoA0CuiRJg.text: 6 of us came for dinner tonight and the great reviews don't do this fabulous restaurant justice. From the warm greeting by Chef Mike to the complimentary garlic bread and meatballs we knew we were in for a special evening. Based on Mikes recommendation we started with the caprese salad and pizza as appetizers and both were superb. We then had frutti de mare which was a fabulous seafood dish along with chicken Sinatra and delicious gnocchi with home made meatballs and home made Italian sausage. Even though we were stuffed we had to try the deserts which were a deliciously refreshing limoncella, outstanding tiramisu, and a unique Roman chocolate cream puff like dish. Throughout the whole meal Mike continuously checked in with us to make sure we were enjoying ourselves and regaled us with stories about his family which were the inspiration fo opening his restaurant. This was truly a memorable evening and the next time we are in Summerlin we will definitely be back.

Aga5wUGtNX9F1BwJVoiQzw.text: fabulous.. felt I was at home- great dinner.. exceptional service.. owners greet  and come to table making sure your night is wonderful.

1hv1MOXeJG4dD1XCk_YGaQ.text: My Mother's House was a fantastic experience! From the warm friendly voice of Laura and Cheryl on the phone  when making a reservation to the smile of Laura welcoming us made us feel like we were walking into a friends home.   The owner Mike came right to our table to welcome us into his "home".  The food was so delicious and such generous servings. , the entertainment was an extra nice touch.  It was a great night.  We drove  from green valley because we heard this was a great restaurant and we were Not disappointed at all!   I definitely recommend My Mothers House for a delicious meal.  We can't wait to go back

IvaoncN_W471F-wsm6VU2w.text: I took my mom for her 85th birthday.  She has dementia and doesn't do much.  We had so much fun!!  Tears in my eyes to see her enjoying the music and Michael singing to her. He went out of his way to make the night special for her.  Good is good.

ylo61CW8qcKfd8hEFdHFHw.text: My wife and I went to "My Mother's House" for our date night because Yelp told us of a new restaurant. The restaurant used to be Mykonos and unfortunately they had to close down due to an accident in the family. Greek is hard to find in this town and Italian is a dime a dozen,  so you need to be good. With that being said, I tried to give this place a fair rating.  The staff was nice and courteous as well as the wife of the owner... It is a bit pricey for what it is seeing I can't imagine the rent would be more expensive as the prior restaurant,  so why would pasta dishes be so expensive? Approx 3-4 items were not available that night due to numerous excuses, but that could be overlooked too seeing it's a new restaurant. The owner was a bit over the top though and not in a good way. If I want a wise guys style restaurant, I'll go to Capo's. The owner/head chef apparently doesn't cook, but prepares all day and then comes back in the evening to schmooze all the retirees from Sun City. He tries too hard to be Vinny Bag O Donuts vs. Arty Buco. Seeing an owner come out and greet tables from the kitchen is more appropriate than trying to be an extra from Goodfellas. I've been to Naples Italy several times and this isn't what the food is like there.

Ft5vPlLfw2IcdRhcUGS6vQ.text: Amazing food! The owner is the sweetest guy you'll ever meet! Our two year old daughter loved the live music! Great place!!

Fsw5jY6bDb5_ymt1AzBADg.text: We have been four times now and the place is always packed. We ended up sitting outside so they brought over three heaters to make sure we were comfortable. 2KaVat4j78xSsDZwgW4z6Q.text: So incredibly yummy. Excellent service and a great environment. You really do feel like you are at your mothers table. Thank you for a wonderful dining experience.

Any shortcomings that we saw last year are gone -- the food is top notch- large portions  - wait staff attentive and friendly- wine pours are double what you would expect- and the entertainment is Vegas Strip quality.  Michael is a natural on the floor greeting patrons, as well when he's on stage.  You need to go to see for yourself, but not too often please -- we want to make we can get reservations, ourselves, at least twice a month.

gk-QRG0LoGA7iGWhOSP1cg.text: This the worst excuse for a Italian restaurant I have ever heard of seriously yuck everything tasted salty and reheated I had the chicken parm and it was awful I've had better chicken parm at olive garden the waitress was great and helpful but the owner was rude and acted like we were just complaining to complain they didnt want to remove the chicken parm from our bill and when I asked about the entertainment fee she rolled her eyes. KjPoAdxU257gKhl3bKddLA.text: Pinch me, I must be dreaming! We wanted Italian food for dinner (it was National Spaghetti Day - 4 Jan) and we're pleasantly amazed by this restaurant. We were cordially  greeted by a few gents in matching striped red and gold shirts while walking up to the entrance, and thought nothing of it. Upon walking it, we were struck with surprise by how packed the restaurant was. My girlfriend and I thought that we surely weren't getting a table (we should have made reservations), but we TOTALLY lucked out and got a table because someone had cancelled. Laura (owner) sat us at "The Family Table" and made us feel just like family with her charming smile and personality.   Cousin Kris (our sever) was very attentive and professional. We ordered one of each of the specials, orange roughy with picatta sauce and "The Spoon" brisket with roast vegetables. Next thing you know... those guys in matching shirts from the parking lot took the stage! We had no idea there was entertainment!!! Chef Michael (owner) crooned us as his band accompanied with flair and pizzazz.   The roast was just as described, tender enough to slice with a soup spoon! The gravy that came with the roast was rich & delicious and the vegetables were cooked to perfection. The orange roughy with picatta was superb and light. While we were both completely full, we couldn't leave without dessert. Initially we were going to share ice cream and ended up also getting the St Anthony's Coppa (cream puffs smothered in semi sweet chocolate) and the Lemoncello.   We can't say enough about how magical the evening was. Michael, Laura and the rest of the staff really made us feel like we were family. The food was incredible and the music was classy and uplifting.

s_uVfitnLZWJRRgmzUKaKQ.text: A lovely family-friendly gem with great Italian food, great service and entertainment!   We dined here as a large group a few days after Christmas and had a great experience.  The staff was super friendly to our young son and very tolerant of him running around which we very much appreciated.   We decided to order family style since there was a bunch of us and I think that was the right call. Everyone got salad which was basic but well-dressed, garlic bread and then the big family style platters came out. The food was made with care and all tasted good. No dish in particular sticks out in my mind as being over the top delicious but it was definitely good enough for me to say I'll come back and recommend this place to others. The Frutti Di Mare platter was quite impressive looking. Awesome for pics and bragging. Again food was tasty and served hot.   The Chef/owner stopped over and told us about his family and restaurant history and we appreciated the background info. We   My only gripe is that they sat us at a table that was far too small for the number of people we had. Our chairs were packed in so tight that we couldn't move and had to climb out of our chairs. We did have a reservation that we booked over a week in advance so I was a little disappointed to be so packed in. If we knew it would be that tight, we would have been happier split at 2 tables. So if you do book for a larger party of 12+, keep that in mind or perhaps arrive a few minutes early to ensure you are happy with the table.   Overall it was a good experience and we will return. Likely on a show night and with a smaller group so we can enjoy the entertainment they provide and try some different dishes.  Locals- go here for a date night or special occasion!   Tourists- if you have a rental car, it's a bit of drive from the Strip but worth it to see a cool neighborhood Vegas gem. There's also good views of the city from this area of town.

8eigUURfklbGGFRDe0WMVQ.text: Super club restaurant. Great entertainment Wednesday's Friday and Saturday. Old style lounge show. Good food. Fun. Unique. Owner is a great entertainer too. $5 cover on those days they perform.

YEA58UCSPghnfpGdVlEDyQ.text: This hidden gem is absolutely amazing! I'm so happy we tried this place out. It was definitely well worth the drive. Food was very delicious. A6x1bvqlt2zmRX7l2UQKsA.text: WHAT A FUN PLACE! Our 22 year old godson recommended this place to us- he knows all the best places for locals. Chef Mike was so friendly and warm and he sang his heart out. The band was fantastic. Music from the 40's, 50's, and 60's/Ratpack/old Vegas lounge style.   I have never been to a place where you have the table all night. They don't turn the tables! So the atmosphere is relaxed and you are with the same people while you are there- more like you are at a show than a restaurant.  The wait staff were really hustling and attentive.   I got chicken marsala and it was the best I've ever had. And I've had it a lot! Husband got meatballs he said were delicious. All the meals came with salads and overall it was very inexpensive. I can't wait to bring my husbands Italian mother-she's going to love it!  Make sure to tip the band!

i1pbbShJakHsDaN8IHDu3g.text: My husband and I went to MY MOTHER'S HOUSE for dinner.  Food was great and the wait staff was exceptional.  They treat you like family when you go to MY MOTHER'S HOUSE.  We highly recommend them to anyone who loves Italian food.

xLC2ILSDmFASglFIPMb3-g.text: I was intrigued by the title of this restaurant so on a beautiful January evening a friend of mine dropped in. They are located in Summerlin Sun City. They are kind of hidden away but they do standout in the strip mall they are located in.  Little did I know that reservations are always expected but we arrived early enough that they were able to seat us. We were welcomed warmly and because the evening was so comfortable, we ate outside with a nice heat lamp to take the slight chill off. We had the whole patio to ourselves which was lovely!  Our server was super friendly, attentive and upbeat. She explained all we needed to know about the menu and the offered dishes. I wish I could remember her name but it escapes me! I think it is unique that each employee is referred to as a cousin, aunt, uncle etc. Makes you feel like they are one big happy family. It is encouraged to order family style and even though there were only two of us, we decided the try the chicken parmigiana with their house salad. We also enjoyed some antipasto which my friend just loved. We both ordered a glass of wine and their serving portions are very generous.  Our salads arrived promptly and when I took my first bite, all I could taste was salt. I thought at first maybe it was just the dressing but then I took another bite and again very salty. I am a little sensitive to salt as I don't add additional salt to my food. I asked my friend if she tasted it and she said yes and we both were wondering why so much salt in a salad. The greens themselves were fresh and tasty but the intense salt just ruined the salad for me. Next up was the Chicken Parmigiana. The presentation of the dish was really pretty and  the portions were very abundant! We both dove in and for me this dish was just ok. The chicken was a little on the dry side but the pasta and sauce were tasty. We both filled up quickly so I gave the leftovers to my friend to take home.  What makes this little place so fun is the evening entertainment. The owner Michael sings and makes everyone feel right at home. He made sure he came over to our table and introduced himself and was very personable which my friend and I appreciated. Although we were sitting outside, we could still hear the band and Michael. Everyone inside was having a great time.  I may bring my Mom back to this place as I think she would really appreciate the good time that this place brings along with the fantastic service!

They make you feel like family here!  I can't say enough how wonderful and what a hidden gem this place is!!!  Just so so special!!! t8OL1qXFwN3tMq_wTx--3A.text: My kids (13, 12, 9) and I decided we wanted Italian food and to try somewhere new. We found this place on Yelp and thought it sounded amazing.   -The environment would get this place 5 stars if that was all we wanted. The owners and staff were all amazing! Greeted right away, great music, fun atmosphere, friendly, interaction staff/owners had with the kids.. fun! Not your typical restaurant in a good way.  I wasn't aware of the entertainment fees for Friday's until we sat down and looked at menu- $5/ each guest- which wasn't bad given the entertainment, but I hadn't budgeted that piece when I estimated the cost of dinner/tip that night.   -The problem I had was I wasn't prepared for the cost or mediocre food. The dinners were huge- each individual plate could feed 2-3 of us which explains the $20-30 price per plate. No kids menu. They did have a family meal option, but we couldn't all agree on one item. The food wasn't bad, but it wasn't worth the cost. For four of us - me drinking water and no deserts (although they gave the kids suckers and a scoop of ice cream for free -looked like they did that for all the kids in the place) we spent over $200, but came home and ate our grocery store food. That could just be our personal taste though.   Overall, we had a good night and I wasn't angry nor did I want to complain when we left. But I don't think we'd pick it as somewhere we'd go again.

9L_XqSUw1Eo6djco6ni1jg.text: We've been in Las Vegas for years and ate in many restaurants and saw many shows.  This place is the best of both worlds.  What a great time.  We ate, we sang, we laughed, and we danced.  Chef Mike and the band were great, performing and interacting with the customers throughout the evening.  We highly recommend My Mothers Place especially on band nights.  Chef Mike's wife Laura was the perfect host.  We were there for three hours and can't wait to return.     Ray

vDp2aU8zw-kxK64hH8kUMg.text: My mother in-law is Italian and we love to try different Italian restaurants in town.  Hands down this is THE BEST. T2moZlsw6KiK5oL7Dtbr_Q.text: They were out of some items, so we settled on the 'Uncle Frank', which says it serves 2-4 people.  There was enough food for the two of us, but no way would it serve 4! oMVD7IfxkUVGOlClouxfSg.text: I have to be honest walking into this place I wasn't so sure about it. The second we sat down our waitress and owner chef Mike were more than gracious in welcoming us. 7Wk2dbyjAcCM5Rfdu6QFpw.text: We (my fiance and I) have visited this restaurant a total of four times now, even though it's only been open for a few months.   Our first visit was fantastic, with the exception they were out of soda. We ordered the polenta with meatballs and sausage and were assured by our server that it was more than enough to share. Sure enough, it was a huge portion size with plenty of meatballs and sausage, probably 3-4 of each. We were very pleased with the dish, and had enough for each of us to have leftovers the next day.  Chef Michael was out on the floor, greeting guests. We understand it's his restaurant and he wants his guests to feel welcome, but he was much too loud in such a small restaurant and overly boisterous. He yelled across the restaurant at other customers for trying to leave without saying goodbye. We left after eating and tried not to draw his attention to us, lest we be yelled at also.   Our second visit, about a week and a half later, was pretty disappointing. They were out of soda, the type of pasta I wanted, and when we asked for more of the bread, the waitress took our bread basket with two half eaten end pieces, put two more end pieces in it, and brought the same basket back. We almost left a Yelp review (would have been 3 stars), but decided against it, since it was a pretty new restaurant, they still have the kinks to work out.   Our third visit, we decided to order take out and split the polenta. When we got home, there was only one meatball and one sausage in the entire dish. For $19, we definitely expected more than one meatball and one sausage, especially when it's supposed to be family style with enough to share, and we had ordered this exact same dish before, and as previously stated, there were plenty of meatballs and sausage.   I was very upset and I called the restaurant. Laura, one of the owners, I believe, was very apologetic and understanding about the situation. She talked to the chef about it, and I overheard him defending it, saying he is always careful about only putting one meatball in every order. The menu explicitly says 'meatballS' plural, and when I order from an Italian restaurant, I definitely expect more than one meatball in my order, especially for $19.  Again, Laura was very nice about it, and insisted that she wanted to make the situation right, and to just let her know it was us the next time we order and she will do what she can to make us happy. She acted appropriately as an owner/manager, and if I was reviewing just her service, she definitely deserves 5 stars.   Since she had promised to make it right, two days later we called in another order of the polenta to split. Fifteen minutes later, I arrive at the restaurant by myself, which is packed as it is a Saturday night. I introduce myself to Laura, who remembers me. She gets Michael to come over, and tells me to tell him know what the problem was. As I begin to explain that I was a frequent customer and had been upset by our last visit, he straight up WALKS AWAY as I'm speaking to him. Literally mid-sentence, he just turns and walks out the patio door to the outdoor seating area, no excuses, no apologies. Laura looked at me and said, "I guess we lost his attention."   It was indescribably rude and frankly, unacceptable for an employee, much less an owner. After he finished whatever he rudely walked off to do, he came back. When I explained how I had only received one meatball and sausage in our last order he said 'that's how it is!'    I replied that not only have we ordered it before and had multiple meatballs and sausages, the menu states the dish comes with multiple meatballs, and how can they justify a $19 entree that only has 2 pieces of meat that is supposed to be shared family style.  He cut me off and loudly announced that he'd give me 2 meatballs, scratch that, 3! And then walked off again. He didn't offer any apologies or consolation whatsoever, for either the dish or walking away in the middle of a conversation.   Apparently, Chef Michael is more interested in singing in the band and greeting old friends than he is in actually running a restaurant.   I hate leaving negative reviews, but you can tell by the length of this review that I was very very unhappy with our experiences at this restaurant. Again, the food is generally good, the service is hit or miss, but it is absolutely unacceptable for a business owner to walk away from someone trying to express their dissatisfaction with their meal, especially when they gave you the opportunity to fix it.   We will not be returning to this restaurant.

jjDl1IJ5RxIQA6tcISLxUA.text: Just moved into a new area and checked for a new Italian spot to hang my hat via yelp. Yes, this is the place! The meatballs were so tasty it had me questioning my own, the braccole was tender, the sausage home made and not dry. Today is my birthday and I'd loved how the music and good family vibes brought me where I often find myself longing to be.... great job guys!!

UzwBZ_hNJ_mRturodRm63g.text: We picked a wonderful place to enjoy our anniversary dinner! Customer service was wonderful, Doris did a great job and the live piano set a romantic mood. BeE0dX6m9W0-b_iRs7w9MA.text: We were so happy to find this place on Mother's day to have a nice dinner, and we loved everything about this place...!   The server lady was super nice and helpful and the owner/chef Mike came by the table several time to check and chat with us on this busy day. He even did a little entertainment for the kids plus free ice cream.. What more can we ask for...!   We have 4 adults and two kids and we ordered 3 family meals. The portions is huge... Plenty leftover for next  a couple days.  They even give us a little gift bag filled with Italian cookies to take home... I have nothing but greatest experience of this place.  And so happy it's just 5mis away from my house.  Highly recommend for summerlin friends if you just want a nice kids friendly place to hang out with live music .

tcrhIvpOSytYYEvBO1J3Dg.text: Great tasting Italian food. Probably one of the best lasagna you could get in Vegas. Also had a super delicious chicken dish that was the special of the day. But save some room for dessert the limoncello is to die for.

IK_Mo4jQZYZKz1-oLt8zpw.text: This place is simply amazing. THE BEST BAKED ZITI I HAVE EVER HAD, bar none.  Mike and Laura are wonderful. Very affable and charming. The live music was a bit loud inside, but great listening from the patio. The decor was wonderful as well. I loved that they spent the time to liven up the patio.   Food: The antipasto provided was good. The carrots and celery were standouts, but the bell pepper and olives were a miss with up (although we are not whole olive people).  Now, about that garlic bread .... simply amazing, especially fresh out the oven. So garlicky. So good.   We got an order of the French Onion Soup, and it was really good. I've really only had better in France. Seriously. It was that good.  The salad was simple, but delicious. Just lettuce and onion with a house dressing. A great palate cleanser.  Mains: We shared a small family style baked ziti. IT WAS AMAZING. I visited a Italian grandmother in the Bronx one time, and she made me my first baked ziti. That was delicious. This was better. I would fill a bathtub with this ziti and dive in.  Amber got an order of chicken picatta. It was tasty. It was not my favorite, but she loved it. I can't wait to try the chicken marsala on my next visit. It is served with a side of linguini, with a marinara style sauce. The marinara is very tasty, but next time I would get the pasta dry so that I could add it to the picatta sauce.  For desert, we had chocolate shakes. They were great. They also give you little cookies on your way out, but our server gave us them early so we could eat them with the shakes. It was a great touch.  Service: Service was amazing. Except for one time having to ask a busser to get some water, our waitress was on it. She gave great recommendations, and Amber and I had a great wine with dinner for like the first time ever. She even had the kitchen delay our mains when we forgot to order our appetizer.  Honestly, other then the music volume (which was perfectly solved by us sitting on the patio), my only complaint of any kind was that Mike had a decent splash of cologne on. I think I am a bit sensitive to it, so it may have felt more then it really was, but I was glad I was outside :-)  Would give 10/10 if I could. I highly recommend this place! If you are on the fence about trying it, at the very least, go meet Mike and Laura. You will feel so welcome, you will sit down and try it.

nV4-fdw1SPot4tHP88o6hQ.text: We have been wanting to come here for awhile and finally came with our kids and their grandparents. Wow it was amazing! Mike the chef is a gracious host and was so great with our kids! We his signature dish and the ravioli and meatball plate. The kids ate for free and he gave them ice cream. We could have stayed all night because the servings were generous. On top of the amazing food the music and ambiance made this my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas and my all time favorite Italian restaurant.

bva__9DCTI4zHeyXo9kVsQ.text: We took our 5 & 7 year old daughters to dinner with us for my birthday. There was a singer and band performing that entertained us for the night. To our surprise it was the owner chef Mike and his amazing band. We were given samples of pizza and meatballs that were incredible! The owner chef Mike greeted my children with excitement and graciously spoiled them with huge lollipops and pasta bowls of amazing-ness. The atmosphere was incredible and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. I would recommend this place to anyone. We will definitely be back. Thank you chef Mike and staff for making my birthday memorable and so enjoyable.

YydnohA4DZfyD-Va1fT-CQ.text: We 4 went to My Mothers House for dinner for our first time and after a Big Welcome by Chef Mike & Laura we felt like we were in My Mom's House. It started with the Smiles that we got when we walked in and didn't stop until we left. They started us with a Garlic Bread and a salad that was a perfect size for 4. We ordered the Fruitti de mare and a Shrimp Scampi also.  When we received the Fruitti da mare I thought that we were feeding the other table besides us to as it was truly enough for 6 to 8 People. The Shrimp Scampi was enough for 2 so with everything on the table we could have fed 10. The food could not have been any better as we all looked at each other and smiled. Linda and I are both Italian and we thought that the sauce was just like Moms. omg it was Great. Angela Loved her Shrimp Scampi and we also had a MALBEC wine which was very good too. For desert there was a Chocolate sensation that included a chocolate from Rome Italy & Teramisu & a Cheese cake that was delightful and Laura brought over a Lemacella Parfeit that was to die for. With Mike & Laura both stopping by the table to check on us and make sure that all was ok it made for a Great Evening of Food & a few laughs too. If you are in the Summerlin area and crave Italian this is a must STOP for dinner. Believe me we have found a Gem here in Vegas NW area and will be back numerous times I'm sure. Say hi to Mike & Laura and you will be glad you stopped there. When we left we were given each an Italian Cookie and WOW were they good. Remember it is  "MY MOTHERS HOUSE" in Summerlin. Buona Mangiata

Jamie Grant on keys....beautiful player and fun. I will go back again and again. About $100 per couple with one glass of wine each. Food portion are large.  Aunt Cheryl is so sweet, I cant wait to go back and see her again. Oh and the tiramisu was the bestihave EVER had....made by Chef Mike.  Oh my goodness was it good!

mNjVseNidPgVnudX9rARRg.text: We had a great experience it was my son's birthday we decided to try this restaurant and we heard so much about it it went above and beyond our expectations the food was outstanding the ambience was great the music was great I highly recommend this place they take great care of their guest it's like old time Vegas it's back baby

The band here is talented, energetic and play the best music. The service here is also so great. And I can't even explain the flavorful food here is incredible!!! Will be back very soon!!! MBWNw3jxkOURxMEwyUrcZA.text: This is a wonderful little gem. I dont like live music. The night we were there, Saturday night, had a live band. They were awesome. It was perfect and added to the charm of the restaurant. The wait staff was very helpful, courteous, and attentive. The food was better than expected.

V_B9SAxl--RHnnVodFutlA.text: I ate here for the first time this evening, and probably not my last. I was extremely impressed that the couple that owns the place greets you personally. When was the last time that happened? The food and Chianti were both terrific. I enjoyed the Sinatra-styled music, too. I look forward to returning.

3lQYwdZ1kkQWFKBXuEYzpg.text: Stopped in for a Saturday night birthday dinner with some friends. Great atmosphere and friendly attentive staff. Communal style tables were full and fun. Family style food portions were very large and attractive, but unfortunately so salty that most of the flavors were lost in the Aunt Carmela's dish we ordered. Particularly liked the rigatoni and peppers. Live entertainment was talented and fun but MUCH too LOUD! This small restaurant does not need so much amplification of the band. Volume was so excessive that conversation was all but impossible during the music sets. Rounded off the evening with a nice slice of cheesecake and coffee. Will probably return, but will definitely try to get a table much farther away from the band!

6cbphUi6fzATpEq8L9ls2w.text: Mike, thank you for the wonderful evening eating at your restaurant. The food and the service was second to none. I will definitely come back again.

H6pmP_in0BOOBD1tdT_N5A.text: After a long day my mother and I were looking for somewhere new to eat in town. We decided to try this place out. As soon as we walked in I felt a homey feeling from the decor. We were greeted by one of the owners who was beyond sweet and makes you feel like she has known you your entire life. Being from New York ourselves we just loved the whole feel of the place. Tables were close together but that made our experience nice because we enjoy meeting new people, the football game was on and we all started chatting. The food was amazing, the other owner (I'm sorry I'm terrible at remembering names) suggested something and I went for it. It was blue crab from Maryland and unlike most places they did not hold back on the seafood! There was so much I had to take it home! It was delicious and I enjoyed trying something I've never had before. Our waiter Dylan was very down to earth, friendly and professional. We will be requesting him next time we come.. which will be soon and often! I can't wait to bring my friend who is in love with frank sinatra she will absolutely love the experience. Telling everyone I know about this place! See you soon!

PiR23Ih26JW9WRYCFRIWQQ.text: This place is absolutely it! The owner, Chef Mike, is as good a host as it gets. He offered us any table in the restaurant and made us feel welcomed as he very enthusiastically described some of the specials not listed in the menu. If you're looking for a real Italian experience, look no further. The place is decked out in family heirlooms and memorbilia from the Rat Pack and former stars such as Sinatra and Louis Armstrong and they have a pianist playing all the classics.         The food is second to none. Right away you're introduced to garlic bread and Chef Mike's grandmother's bolognese sauce which is one of the best I've had and at the right price (complimentary!) We then had the braciole which my girlfriend said was the best Italian dish she's ever had. It was accompanied with a neopolitan salad which includes some kind of lemon-vinaigrette (my guess) that definitely impressed. Next was the Aunt Carmela. We had a large to share between 4 of us. Oh. My! Besides the fact that it looks and tastes like everything you dream of from an authentic Italian spot, there was so much that we ended up leaving with two separate to go boxes, and out of our half, my girlfriend and I both had lunch plans for the next day. We finished with St. Anthony's coppola which included chocolate from Rome and a homemade whipped cream which was to die for. Throughout the meal I had a glass of Chianti and a dessert wine which I forget the name of. Both of which were fantastic wines and complimented the meal perfectly.       I will definitely be coming back and be sure to bring all of my family and friends. Look no further, grab a reservation, and enjoy everything Chef Mike and his wife have to offer. You will not regret. Salute!

XdSqdynJHsDPQyKeldqi3A.text: I have seen the reviews for this restaurant and is looking for a good Italian restaurants to go to. I just happened to be in the area so I stopped by. The owner Mike is very nice and let me have a seat during hours between lunch and dinner I asked about the fruit De Mer that was so popular on Yelp and he said it's very big so he had it made for me half order. the salad that came with it was simple and delicious not a lot of salt but well-balanced. The garlic bread was good dipping into the sauce that they provided I was totally shocked when I saw my order 1/2 order of fruit De Mer. It was huge massive amount of food I think I counted at least five large Blue Crabs.. muscles, clams, and shrimp linguine that came with it was very well cooked the flavor of the sauce is garlicky and goes great with the French bread I barely can get through 20% of the food before I gave up and ask for a to-go tray. I gave me the grade for the restaurant based on five criterias: price, quality,quantity, service, and taste( not necessarily in that order) this one for my first visit is a 5. The fruit De Mer was delicious and huge. Will be back to try other food on the menu.

b7ThpgBbY3C8bQsQb96J9w.text: This place is very homy. The owner goes around to all the tables and speaks with everyone. They have live music sometimes which is fun especially because they are good singers. So it is a really good environment. The food was really good! We got the seafood pasta and it is a must try!

MiqwfI6XEHuZc-DvTqXDgQ.text: This is the THE best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas and it is in our neighborhood.  The food is off the charts, the ambiance is elegant and the service is world class.  Food plus service plus entertainment = an evening you will remember forever!

FbeAN2vCOOBl2zNknyzxiA.text: My dad and I came here for a father-daughter date and it did not disappoint. Chef Mike welcomes you at the door and creates an experience the moment you step inside. TzUlILJfmbe25XlWcT_tIA.text: Took my boyfriend here for date night! Was expecting good Italian food and some live music. What we really got was dinner at what felt like family's house. Photo of My Mother's House Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gnocchi and Jumbo Shrimp Scampi Over Linguine

5pSGI_SOX6D97qxyvIaXFg.text: First off, I want to say this place was absolutely amazing. We walked in early about 4:30 pm and all the tables were reserved except for one. How lucky were we to get a table. We were welcomed with a smile and the owner sat us. It was like being at grandma's house. Chef Mike came to welcome us. Did I mention we were the only ones there and it was our 1st time. He told us his food specials and I was convinced to get the crab over linguine. We also ordered the lasagna and the meatballs over linguine. The dishes came with a simple refreshing salad and we got a complimentary garlic bread with their bolognese sauce. The dishes were big enough to share and they were so good, so flavorful and absolutely amazingly delicious. Delicious,  amazing and so so so so so flippin good!!!! The desserts were out of this world. We had the tiramisu, limoncello, and cheese cake with a bourbon peach sauce. Did I mention, amazingly delicious. Now, we were told since we took the last table we can stay for the entertainment and so we did. Wow, wow, wow!!! Chef Mike can cook, bake and sing. We danced and sang and had just a great time, all the while the waitress was checking up on us and refilling our water. My mom even danced with Mike's wife. We had such a great time!!

photos.caption: Photo of My Mother's House Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Getting ready for the Blue Crab delight.

qqRGup_e8cdRL52MvVfEEw.text: We had pre theater reservations at 5 PM and the restaurant was not very busy upon arrival. We were greeted by owners Laura and later by chef Michael as he made the rounds of the tables. The restaurant was sold out on this night with most of the people coming in at 6 PM to enjoy the music. The dining room is not very large and the tables are close together. The decor is very nice with many photos of entertainers and celebrities. The men's room even has some beautiful photos of Marilyn Monroe.  Dinner began with a complementary bread basket of garlic bread and  bowl of marinara sauce. A very hearty starter that can fill you up. Next was a family style salad of romaine lettuce dressed with lemon, olive oil, and onions. This was a very refreshing arrangement.  Our entrees were: The Chicken Piccata is made with sherry wine, lemon butter, Kalamata olives and artichoke hearts. The chicken was tender and the wine lemon mix was perfect. The amount of artichokes are way more than my wife prefers.   The amount of artichokes in the dish was overwhelming. When our server Franco came to check on us my wife commented on the amount of artichokes and he immediately suggested that dish be replaced. In a few minutes a replacement dish the Sinatra Chicken appeared and was well received.  Chicken Sinatra is a 12 oz breaded cutlet cooked to perfection. The breast was tender and juicy. The chicken was totally covered with roasted red peppers and served with zucchini. This is a great entree not found in many restaurants.   The dinner portions are large and include salad and pasta. We passed on the pasta since we were going to the theater.  This restaurant reminded me of the supper clubs back in the day in Chicago. Not conversation friendly while the band is playing but definitely a fun evening  The band was a four piece group plus the singer chef Michael. The band was well  versed in the old standards.  Overall, this is a fun place to enjoy good food and great entertainment. Our server Franco was on point helping us with the menu and checking on our satisfaction. We will be back  to experience dessert and the music.   We hope the locals continue to support this family owned an operated restaurant in Sun City Summerlin.

mKNdr73ikfl-llJBBMwcdQ.text: Very disappointed in this establishment. The best thing on the menu is the seafood feast but any other entrees where you're getting the red sauce you need to skip. Didn't try the Alfredo sauce but how hard is it to make a good sauce. Apparently harder than it is. I told the owner we were celebrating our wedding anniversary and they never even acknowledged it during the evening. If you're not going to acknowledge it or send out a special dessert then why ask if we are celebrating something special?? Won't be returning.

2LRN1TaZymuKK2O_uVIc0w.text: By far one of the most amazing Italian joints in Las Vegas! Looking for the nice home cooked meal, great atmosphere and amazing people, you've found it. Completely blown away by the service, food, music and overall experience. Treated like family the second we walked in the door and the portions were ITALIAN SIZED for sure! Absolute must try for locals and tourists alike, we will be back again without question!

photos.caption: Photo of My Mother's House Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine Alfredo

SexhqOchAfrGzbyrYcEuYw.text: My friend and I stopped by here on a whim. We were in the mood for Italian but wanted to try something new, so I did a quick google search and found "My Mothers..." and it was really close to my house! Exited, we arrive around 630 pm. We had a little trouble finding the place because the GPS kept rerouting and it's tucked into a small shopping area.      Once we opened the door we were a little startled because we didn't expect the atmosphere, at first we thought we had come under dressed. We were approached by our hostess, one of the owners and they placed us at a table by the kitchen door. The place itself is rather small and they already had a good amount of people dining. There were two stages and lots of instruments. Which, we learned upon opening our menu its a $5 charge per person to be on the nights they perform, which of course was a night we were there. A Tuesday no less.     We decided to stay despite the extra $10 charge just to sit there and looking over a pricey menu. We were approached by the owner, a differnt one from before, and he was nice and shook our hands, which I enjoy because it definitely gives you a more welcomed feeling.     We ended up skipping a much wanted appetizer because the prices of the dinners were just so steep. Although we did enjoy their free basket of garlic bread and their dipping sauce, it was fabulous. We wanted more but you'd be charged.      My friend ended up ordered their Chicken Sinatra, $26.00. She also opted to have her side of pasta with alfredo sauce and not marinara. I decided on their Shrimp Scampi, $29.00.     While waiting for our food to arrive, the owner who had so nicely introduced himself to us earlier jumped on the mike and started singing. Which was fine.... it was just crazy loud. Being such a small space and loud music like that made it a little uncomfortable.     Our salad arrived first which I enjoyed but my friend did not because she got a big chunk of raw onion so it was off putting to her. Our food then arrived, in good time and our waitress was also very polite which I feel is nice to point out. I liked mine, the scampi, I just wish there was more body to the both it was sitting in. It was hard to get any of the actual scampi sauce on my linguine. My friend liked the chicken but did not enjoy their alfredo at all. I pointed out that it's prepared differently, with egg, and it's just not something she's used to. So I wouldn't say it was bad, it just wasn't her cup of tea if you will.      Overall, I'm not opposed to coming back but they won't be my first choice. The prices were just too high with quality of food and just a very loud restaurant.

oEYgVZAl8KuXFMu5Z1WWwA.text: Chef Mike and Laura you guys are amazing and made my families experience here one of a kind! Thank you so much for the great hospitality and making us feel at home! Very clean and fresh bathrooms. All the dishes are HUGE So bring your appetite!  Much Love Sam Nelutescu

photos.caption: Photo of My Mother's House Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese Homemade Cheesecake

LWAbpbogjRXxp8OkKPyKGQ.text: I cannot express how amazing our experience was with this place.  First, let me just say that I was shocked to talk to Chef Mike when I called in to make my reservation. I had worked as a waitress for chain restaurants before, and I was very impressed that the owner of the restaurant was answering phones and taking reservations.   My husband and I are parents of three children. One is 6 months, one is 3 years, and one is 9. Going out to eat when we can is a real treat for us, but it's extraordinarily challenging. Naturally, I felt nervous about going into the restaurant with our energizer bunnies, but as soon as we walked in we were greeted and welcomed like we were family. They completely enchanted our children, even the baby, and there was not a single comment made about technology by either of the kids the whole two hours at dinner (the fact that we were able to eat out anywhere for two hours, still amazes me!). Our kids absolutely fell in love with the atmosphere and the staff, and because they enjoyed themselves so much, my husband and I were really able to enjoy ourselves too. It was a dinner I know the kids would reminisce about for years to come. It was truly magical!  The food is INCREDIBLE. Everything tasted home made, and even my picky eaters ate their weight in fine Italian Cuisine. We all left almost too full and with left overs to spare.   The entertainment and the music really tops the cake though! We were singing, dancing, and laughing the whole evening. The music is sensational and the atmosphere is fun and vibrant. If you are in the need of a pick me up, this is the place to go. It's not possible to be here and be down in the dumps.   We had to leave sooner than we would have liked because of the baby needing to get home to bed, but the two older kids spent the whole car ride home talking about how much fun they had and asking us when we could go back again. Aside from Lou's Diner, we have never been to a restaurant that had this kind of positive impact on our family. It was a marvelous experience and we are so very thankful!   I highly recommend this place to everyone I know

ZwiyS0ziWP2MsLnN5iEesg.text: Chef Mike made us feel like family! We took 11 people including a baby and two 8 year old boys, and we ALL had a blast! Dinner was delicious and the show was amazing! Old school Vegas music with home cooked Italian food. A great experience that we definitely plan to repeat in the near future!

We were greeted by Sal and he took really good care of us throughout the night. The music was great! If you love Sinatra you'll love it here. I think we found our new spot!

However, the food was not up to my expectations.  The red sauces were too seasoned, the lasagna mediocre, the ziti boring and the desserts subpar.  However, the meat dishes looked good, salads well done and garlic bread delicious.  You get the table for the evening and the entertainment is strip quality.

ZTQ25Qptt3jPMRu7N5chZA.text: Four stars for the service and entertainment. The food was more on the three star level, but a fun experience, so we will be back. The shrimp scampi and shrimp cocktail were both very good

ZhlDgfKPGz4PYdn9sDBxVw.text: This has been BY FAR the best date night we've had in forever.  Granted, it was a double date with kids,  but THE BEST!!!!   We live on the complete opposite side of town,  but we decided to check this place out.  I was praying that it was worth our trek.   The moment we walked into the restaurant,  we just knew that it was all worth it.    The place was packed, the band was playing,  the ambiance was amazing,  and all the food smelled delightful.    Every single person in the staff greeted us and they were so welcoming.  That is the most important thing to me- but Chef Mike went completely above and beyond.  We had our 2 small daughters at the table. He came over, interacted with them, gave them treats, and made sure they were having the best time.    The band played so well.  We were moving to every song. In between appetizers and our dinner, we got up to dance.  It was seriously a blast.    Dinner was delicious.  We ordered crab cakes for the appetizer.  Linguine and Clams, sauteed shrimp, brisket, & gnocchi. Perfection.  Dessert here is out of this world.  We ordered ice cream for the kids,  tiramisu, and a cannoli.  Chef Mike had us try a few more desserts.  I wish he didn't, because I'm now addicted.  The limoncello is the best I ever had.    We will definitely be returning- not just for the food, but for the experience.  This is a place unlike any other in Las Vegas.

y0F_DBqIa-FCshFr-5ztIQ.text: Me and my husband are foodies. We love finding hidden gems when traveling and My Mother's House did not disappoint! P7q_AFBWvz4eGdB1achukA.text: I'm from old school Brooklyn New York. Hands down this place has the best Italian food I've ever eaten out. Chef Mike is a great host and a great chef. His food brought me back to when I was a kid eating at my grandmothers house. His wife made the best egg cream I've had in over 45 years. Brought me back again to my childhood days. The desserts are to die for. Can't wait to eat here again. Thanks to my good friends who brought me here to try it out.

fMUjTc8gBrFddEFqbP7PLg.text: We have visited this new restaurant twice now and have been very impressed with the food and the dedication to quality that they have. This is a great addition to the Sun City community. The family section of the menu has very generous portions at very reasonable prices and can easily feed 2 or 3 persons. There is a wide variety of Italian dishes and the owner has told us that he adheres to his mother's own recipes. Whatever they are doing, the dishes that we have tried all were excellent in taste and quality of the ingredients.  The lasagne is one of the best that I have ever had anywhere. The chicken parm was very good and had huge amounts of chicken in the dish. The shrimp scampi is not done in a baked style as many other places do, but it has huge prawns over a bed of linguine and it is outstanding.  If you possibly have room for dessert, try the Black Forrest Cake. It isn't your typical German style heavy cake with cherries, etc. It a fairly light cake made with mouse and chocolate shavings and it is wonderful. Not heavy or filling at all.  They only negative that I can relate is that it tends to be a bit on the noisy side. If you want to carry on a conversation with a larger table, it will be a challenge. Past restaurants at this location have failed and we hope that My Mother's is a huge success. If the first couple of weeks are any indication, they are going to be here for a long time. If you are considering going there, DO IT!

-sVIUa9fg8lr61OdiWkzhg.text: This is a relatively new restaurant in Summerlin. Fantastic find. The owner, chef, Sinatra style singer makes you feel like you're in an Italian restaurant in Brooklyn. He makes the rounds the table, says I load everybody, and includes them in the singing. The food, in fact, taste like somebody's grandmother made it. Everything was delicious. One of the best lasagna as I've ever had.

z_jdCnr9KJEIKNpA6Cuslg.text: What an experience. We never felt so at home and welcomed in a restaurant. The food was amazing, Chef Michael was not only an amazing Chef but a fabulous entertainer! This beautiful little gem has all the things you would want to find here in Las Vegas for great Italian food. We went in with two small toddlers (most places put you in the back to keep the other patrons away from whinny kids but these guys put us right up front and welcomed us with open arms.the kids loved it they treat us like family all the staff waiters waitresses and the entertainment were so fabulous.food is not the only thing that makes a restaurant great it's all about the experience, the staff, the taste, and the the general feel of the place and let me tell you this place is awesome. They have a wonderful old school band that plays music from way back. It's older generation style but makes you still wanna get up and dance!   I believe on the weekends is when they play, we went on a Saturday night and they played until closing time. The owner/operator/chef/singer are the most sincere people you will meet! I had the chefs special, orange roughy a beautiful lemon capered creamy sauce with grilled zucchini and a side of spaghetti with homemade marinara. My daughter had the Julius Caesar, which consisted of soft shell crab, yes flown in for his restaurant, shrimp and a ton of other seafood which was delicious there was so much she could not even eat the entire platter which was huge. When we walked in the owner, came to our table had one of the staff bring the Santa Claus phone for our children, and then they called Santa on the microphone and he told the kids he wanted them to have a special prize. Then the staff brought out to very very large lollipops for each of our children which made them very happy and us as well it's just such a beautiful place. Decor was quaint and just like its name, it felt like your mother's kitchen!! Highly recommend this place!!

wCvs_ATdJgtKUnCa10Raow.text: This is an updated review. We became a kind of regular, and we thought the the pizza was very tasty. As time goes by, the toppings are getting smaller and not as delicious as it was. Although we have dined in several times before and have enjoyed the dine in experience but we like to take out the pizza time to time because that used to be great. The food is very tasty in general with good portion except too much olive oil in salad and food in general. The service is excellent and very friendly people. If the pizza gets better, have no complains.

qIyOxfDesOW5ojI0p6IkIA.text: -What a fun place! Michael and Laura dish up more than delicious food. They also take the time to meet and greet you, making you feel like family from the time you walk in to the time you walk out. This is a small joint, very cozy, and kid friendly. Our 8mo old had a great time looking at all the lights and interacring with wait staff.   -The food is delicious, and the portions generous, even the "individual" dishes could be shared. We had the lasagna, ravioli, chx romano (bone-in!), and linguine alfredo. My favorites were the lasagna and ravioli. It was my father-in-laws birthday and they served up a complimentary canoli in celebration.   -LIVE MUSIC a few nights per week starting at 6pm. It was so fun and enjoyable for us. It IS loud....so if you don't like loud, dine in on a different night. Michael surprised us by singing a few tunes himself, which was very cool!   5 stars for this restaurant's authenticity, quality food and experience. We will be back!

HIIw_RPqz6ANHpqEMe2zOA.text: Love the environment, food and service. Already recommended this place to friends and they said the same

X3GAVyjm7jhX0A3ugd9ikA.text: I was hesitant about going here but my family wanted a True Vegas experience, so trusting in the reviews I decided to give it a go,while walking in you're greeted warmly like you're going into your grandmother's house, Michael the owner /chef and his wife were gracious kind along with the staff, made my family feel comfortable. The food tastes just like you're in Italy we tried many different dishes all were exquisite, along with the music that'll surprise you the rat pack 50s music in the show they put on was so much fun with everyone singing, dancing it was a True Vegas supper club.a must try.

M80AVSRuuk5PFbasgv-y8A.text: OK so I have had one of the most amazing dining experiences in a very long time This is definitely a hidden gem that everyone needs to know about and experience My Mother's House is truly wonderful from the minute you walk thru the door right up until you leave Michael  and his wife Laura make you feel like you are truly Family They are warm friendly and so down to earth This is definitely not your ordinary restaurant when you make a reservation and you arrive there that table is yours for the evening no rushing to get you served and out the door you can enjoy entertainment until they close at 9:00 p.m. and the entertainment is awesome Michael himself is a well know entertainer I won't spoil it for you You will have to let him tell you the stories The service is beyond excellent our server was SAL he was awesome so attentive the entire staff was at your Side if you needed them. 9oWe773RetjM_ut6u-XcXw.text: Amazing experience! We were lucky to get a last-minute reservation for 2 on a Friday night. Zvh73uBGJ-YrIZ9p1dRk2g.text: Oh my god if i could give 100 stars i would.  This is by far the best Italian place i have been to in Las vegas  and believe me ive tried tons, mike and his wife absolutely wonderful people, so down to earth and friendly , engaged with our table , our children,  complimentary ice cream for our kids , c'mon what other place does this, NONE.  Chef mike is amazing and talented. lets talk about the food, amazing homemade and made with love kind  of food, the best ive tasted, caprese salad was on steroids lol,  every other place serves a piece of  mozarella and a tomato(flimsy)  this plate came out decked out , huge, delicious,  I was blown away.  8yrs here and we finally found our spot,  we have been looking for a place that reminds us of back home (queens and Brooklyn) to be exact and this is it. wYt_ILzoagjorr9w0fg7TA.text: This place is really charming and has really delicious food!!  The atmosphere, the music, the food, all fantastic!  We went on the weekend and they had a small sign on the table that said "Entertainment charge $5.00 per person" I have never seen that before.... the entertainment was nice but when they come around to your table singing and playing instruments you feel obligated to tip them so now I paid $15 dollars for entertainment... almost as much as my pasta. uxbhKca-ZDrirBtTLCgSvA.text: After reading all the 4 star reviews we decided to give this place a try. Maybe we went on an "off night" or maybe a different place entirely because I would give 1/2 a star if possible. We were told this is their "slow season" so maybe that was it?!?  The garlic bread tasted like it was straight from the frozen aisle at Smith's. The lasagne was $25 a slice so I was expecting something spectacular, large, and/or hearty; it was none of that.. it had 2, MAYBE 3 layers and I don't think there was even meat in it. The chicken piccata was very different from anything else we've ever had with artichokes and Kalamata Olives.   The real kicker was we were charged $5 each for "entertainment". Yes, there was a singer there but it's not like we were serenaded or even requested a song from him. (Note: I did see someone posted a photo of a note on their table of a $5 entertainment charge, but there was NOT on on our table or any other table when we went)   So here we are $90 later (we tipped 20% of course because it's not the servers fault); and vowing to never go back.

kAWv1y4FpAvE86FlAsZhUQ.text: To start off this review, I must say I've been traveling to Summerlin area for three years now. Not one place had ever made me feel at home with their hospitality. My mother's House has officially done that for me. Traveling weekly across the country, this is a marked favorite. Chef Mike and my server, Cheryl provided a five star level of service. I started out with a glass of "four bears" Pinot noir. Followed by a serving of the house Neapolitan salad, and a main coarse of lasagna. The portion of lasagna is enough for two. I was check in with consistently by the staff, and chef mike himself when he was not cooking. All this, and I took home some dessert and have lunch for tomorrow. This place is a MUST for visitors looking for homemade Italian food. Until next time....

Ti2PwdgD4wD5tDnxBQKqSw.text: We came here for our wedding anniversary and so glad we did. Awesome intimate and romantic atmosphere, live music, fresh food, outdoor seating, and VERY large portions. You will have leftovers.

oeZDRbMQ16_UbsKCA2b-Nw.text: My BFF and I were looking for a place to eat dinner (she is picky, I'm not). We settled in Italian and decided to check out My Mother's House. What a lovely surprise.  Chef Michael met us outside, walked us in, handed us off to Cheryl our server for the evening. Cheryl introduced us to this hidden gem and its menu. Chef Michael came around to introduce the night's specials and give us a introduction to his favorites. Then the real treat began.  This is like a dinner club if the 60s/70s. You make a reservation, you come to eat and be entertained, best of all the table is your's for their evening. They do not turn over tables. You don't need to eat and scram. This was a new feeling, but one I can get accostomed to quickly.  The food! Wowza. The bread is scary good. I had the Maryland Blue crab with white sauce and linguine. My BFF had the slow cooked brisket the was spoon/fork tender.  The music was such a treat and to hear some favorite tunes from a previous era was heartwarming.   I will be going back.   Hint: make reservations. We were lucky as it was summer and it is not their busy season. In winter Cheryl tells us, there is no other way to get in.

photos.caption: Photo of My Mother's House Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maryland blue crab with white sauce and linguine.

xYktNd9TKrb_3SH4K3sbJg.text: Love the family owned Italian restaurant. Chef owner Michael is very personable as well as his wife and staff.  Family feeling definitely. Great touch with play toy phone calling Santa with the kids- my Son loved it.   Now for the food- excellent. Great flavors.  BIG SERVINGS- beware.  But left overs were great the next day. Siciliano an pizza was awesome.  They were able to accommodate halting the pizza to just pepperoni on one side and 1/2 half as iChicken Parmesan was great. Another dish with all meats and eggplant pharm was very good as well.   Make room for dessert.  Apps are big and must try. Will definitely come back with family.  Highly suggest bring a big group to share the big plates.

wgQSqmDWRxqSdeIJOUw7ZQ.text: ABSOLUTELY A MUST TRY!   This is a cute and quaint restaurant hidden in Sun City. My husband & I dined here tonight & we were greeted immediately with smiling faces. Chef Mike sat us at a table for 2 which he jokingly called the "Love Bird" table. He immediately introduces himself, gives us a little background on his menu & the recipes. I had the linguine with meatballs. It was amazing. It's not your pasta sauce out of a jar. All ingredients are fresh & full of flavor. The portions are large enough for 2. He boasts about his grandmother's meatball recipe as it was well deserved.   My husband ordered the brisket which was the special tonight and it was excellent. You could cut it with a spoon. It came with a small bowl of pasta and I forgot to mention salad is included too. Salad was light & fresh.   We also ordered a small baked ziti to go for my son and he gave it 2 thumbs up, lol  My husband and I were very full and  had food to take home so we were not going to try any desserts but, Chef Mike treated us to a Lemoncello and it was the best I've ever had. It was actually the perfect dessert to share if you don't have much room in your tummy. It was a light dessert. It had the perfect amount of lemon zest and so creamy.   Franco was our server tonight & he was attentive, friendly, efficient & a very nice guy. Refills happened before we could ask and empty plates didn't sit in front of us for very long. He himself earns 5 stars.   I found the restaurant to feel more like home. I love that there is a Christmas Tree decorating the corner of this restaurant. Chef Mike informed us that his grandmother kept her Christmas Tree up year round. This restaurant feels more like a home. It's very festive as is the outdoor seating.   I can't say enough great things about this Ma & Pa place. I love to see small businesses flourish & I think they're doing everything right.   Oh...They have live music a few nights a week. I can't wait to come back.

cjHE2l2qKQVdlhL-M9DNCQ.text: This place has been on my wishlist for so long!! Luckily they were not so busy on Tuesday night so we got in with no wait.  We felt so welcome as soon as we walked in!! The best part was when chef Mike came to our table with his cool red telephone talking to Santa, my kids loved it! Then he gave them giant lollipops!! The food portions are LARGE!! We tried gnocchi, chicken Marsala and linguine Alfredo. Food was good, lots of sauce!  There is a $5 spilt charge, which is clearly stated on the menu. However next time I would just order a pasta to share! Pasta comes with house salad and chicken comes with salad and side of spaghetti. The garlic bread is to die for. Our server Sal was wonderful.  This was not one of their show days but there was live music with a gentleman playing guitar and singing. He had a great voice, was rocking some good Elton John and Eagles numbers. They charge an entertainment fee of $5 per person and this includes kids. We were charged $20 for 4 of us. I guess this was for the live music? I was under the impression that entertainment fee was only on show days Wednesday, Friday and Saturday.  Tiramisu is one the best, must try. Chef Mike was super sweet and got kids ice cream on the house. Overall, we had a great time.

You are greeted "like family" by owner/chef Michael and his beautiful wife Laura, and the feeling of being in your mothers house is all encompassing! The food was amazing from the House Salad to their home made Tiramisu.   Saturday entertainment was like being at an old school Italian wedding. U-bRkstQA9jxlGoozJZ_Gw.text: If you love the atmosphere of live music which manners include old Vegas favorites with some high energy Italian songs My Mother's House could be your place. Chef Mike met us at the door and enthusiastically greeted us and let us know we were in for a fun night. The band was great and Mike hit the notes.  Uncle Sal serves us and I found out he was from south philly. We had a lot in common. He was an engaging waiter who was attentive.  The food was excellent. Started with garlic bread and along with my spaghetti aioli was a simple but tasty  neopolitan Salad.   If you're looking for a quiet romantic dinner probably not your place but if you love music from a few yesterdays ago with laughs and good Italian food.  Make the trip.   The room is small so make reservations.  Lou and Ava Gardner.

EXsCzn7jGiUOzkmQm8mUVA.text: Ok if you don't have time to read here's the easy version: AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!  Ok here's the longer version: Opened the door and it was the most friendliest place I've ever encountered. We sat down and Franco was just so attentive and kind. Then Chef Mike came out and he was fabulous. He had a phone that he brought out as he was taking with Santa for 2 of my kids. They absolutely loved him. He's just so kind. My 9 year old adored him. We found out he played with Sinatra-amazing stories. My 9 year old asked if we could listen to him in the car on Apple Music  be was so excited that he met someone famous. My older daughter came late and he was so nice to make another call to Santa-adorable.  Ok the food-just wow. You have to be the fritters di mare--it's chef mikes signature dish. So amazing. The platter of seafood was gorgeous. My kids enjoyed the chicken parm-said it was the best they've had. Ohhh I can't forget the salad and bread-delicious.  We ordered 3 desserts and all delicious as well-tiramisu, cheesecake and chocolate puff yummmmmm.  We found out he has entertainment...he performs himself, we came on Thursday and he had a great pianist, and one night he has violinists. We decided we definitely need to go on a night he performs-make sure you make a reservation. I think it will make for an amazing date night. Great food, wine and entertainment. Can't beat it. Old Vegas feel.  LOVE IT!!

3kRJ3VBAiOdOHoqtpHyQ5A.text: You must experience this place! Our family sure enjoyed our time here and cannot wait to come back. Chef Uncle Mike and his staff are so welcoming you feel like your part of the family.   We went on a Thursday so we got to experience a calm environment with the piano in the background and occasionally Chef Mike sang a song and specifically one directed towards my daughter's about being "daddy's little girls"...almost cried.   For food we ordered the Aunt Carmela which is one of the family style dishes. They described the dish to serve 3_4 but 8 could have easily consumed this dish with no leftovers. A Bolognese sauce topped linguine, Italian sausage, meatballs and a delicious eggplant parmesan. So delicious! We also had the Alfredo which had sweetness to the sauce, maybe made with a little ricotta cheese. Also good.   We had to have dessert since we were celebrating a birthday, so we ordered the tiramisu and the St. Anthony. Both were do rich and creamy definitely the best I've had for both desserts. They were so nice they even gave the kids complimentary ice cream, which was a good quality.   My family is already looking forward to our next visit. We plan on going on a Wednesday or Friday because they have entertainment that includes a rat pack style of music, dialogue and comedy that will be really fun.   Enjoy!!

nqvyybsJ9T_VIpapN3KfRA.text: Ordered the chicken parm ziti family style size small for my husband and I. We both had a good sized bowl with leftovers for a third adult. Great portion sizes for the price, I believe it was $32. Considering 1 dish at Olive Garden is a good $15, it's a great deal. We had it for dinner and can both eat it for lunch the next day too. The sauce was chunky, tasted very authentic and homemade. Nothing like the jarred sauces. Oh and they made it with lots and lots and lots of garlic. Even big chunks. That's neither good nor bad, just depends entirely on your taste. So be aware if you don't like garlic, maybe ask if they can do light garlic or something. I thought it was good but I can definitely see if some can see it as overwhelming.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the cheesecake is a bit steep. Granted, you CAN taste the quality of it and again, the homemade-ness of it, but it's just 1 average sized plain slice for $7. I was confused and saw some pictures on here that others posted of blueberry cheesecake so I thought it came with a fruit topping of some sort. My mistake, I should have asked beforehand. But still, $7 for a piece of cheesecake with no toppings or flavors is...eh, not worth it.   Great place, will be back and recommend!

DJSx920pAmTCtzFu5JHOPw.text: Just had an awesome meal. Snow crab feast ( see picture) was perfection. Chicken Marsala melted in my mouth. Meatballs are supple and flavorful. But, leave room for Lemoncello desert which was refreshing and fresh lemon. For chocolate lovers, St. Anthony's cup was amazing. Chocolate rom Italy - not bitter not too sweet - with a cream puff surprise in the center. Well worth the total bill. Owner is personable and full of information on his intentional food and decor choices.

iwjtu6PJrsMb_o_8SO63Eg.text: Great food, great entertainment, Chef Mike is very personable and energetic. The ambiance alone is worth making a visit. Best cheesecake I've had in Vegas.

kiKWjoqIvbChheiuJk2BEQ.text: We happened in here almost by accident after hitting yelp while parked outside and what a great choice because Chef Michael really does use his Mama's recipes . Entertainment in the form of piano music or a trio 6 days a week. Michael is also a singer having performed At the Sands back in the days before the restaurant business. photos.caption: Photo of My Mother's House Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classy piano in this nice upscale Italian restaurant

eE9IWe8j8g1aCIr40BLcwg.text: Where to start with this place...for starters, they require a credit card to make a reservation. I'm not necessarily opposed to that, provided the card information is stored securely, which it's not. But moving on...we arrived for our 8:00 reservation and the live music was in full swing. Now, this place is tiny; maybe a dozen tables. If a mouse sneezed in one corner, you could hear it clear across the place. The music was over-the-top loud. Our party of four couldn't hold a conversation. We couldn't hear the server; she couldn't hear us. Not only did they play loudly, the saxophonist played into a mic! There are actually speakers 10 feet from the band. Thankfully, they stopped just after our salad course. Aside from the way-too-loud music, the decor is absolutely tacky. It doesn't read so much "delightfully collected by grandma over the years" as it does "we're opening a restaurant tomorrow so let's run around to all the HomeGoods stores we can and buy any clearance item that loosely belongs in a restaurant." And then add in the laser light show from a nightclub...like, really?  Moving along...I was ready to overlook all of this for the authentic, home-cooked food they touted. The garlic bread was OK...crunchy and flavorful, with a slightly-too-greasy marinara sauce. Everything went downhill from there. The salad they serve with everything is sad. Just under-dressed lettuce.   And then the entrees came. Chicken marsala...the mushrooms were good. But the breading on the chicken was raw and mushy. Kind of like the cook dipped it but forgot to cook it before putting it on the plate. I asked the server if it was always prepared that way. She went to get 'Chef' Mike, who explained that is exactly how it is supposed to be prepared. In his arrogant way, he attempted to defend his misguided cooking process before finally offering something else. However, having tasted the other three entrees on the table, it was clear that my entree wasn't the problem, but that bad food is the only menu option here. (He did take it off the check, though I always prefer good food over crappy free food.) After all, he informed us that he's a 'very rich man' and isn't going to worry about a chicken.  The meatballs, a staple in Italian joint, had the consistency of wet, very fine mashed together sawdust. Weirdest texture ever for a meatball. Little flavor, too. The gnocchi was undercooked and gummy. And the cheese on the lasagna was rubbery, but not in a good ooey-gooey cheese way. All served with the same greasy, flavorless red sauce. None of us ate more than a third of our meals.  If this place were on Restaurant Impossible or Kitchen Nightmares, you can just tell that the owner would think everyone else is crazy and he's the only right one. Now, I don't like giving negative reviews to independent places, but there's just nothing good about this place. I sincerely hope they had an off night, but there's no way I'm going to put myself through another night at My Mother's Place to find out.  (And I'm 100% sure the owner will respond to this review with something like "you could have just left.")

7-gpLVPzvht5UqCH4V3qYg.text: I can't say enough about this great restaurant. The owners Mike and Laura are amazing. They have created an environment not just a restaurant. We have been looking for many years in Las Vegas for a place  that "has" it. We found it here.   The food is as close to what we know as authentic Italian cuisine from Phillie and New York. If you close your eyes you hear the rat pack and Sinatra singing to their family.   That's Mikey!! We brought our professional musician son and his girlfriend visiting from Portland and they put my son, Daniel Rossi on drum set, and he played with his band and killed it!  Everyone was having such a great evening. They brought down the house! My Mother's House is definitely our favorite place  and you need to make it yours because they deserve the support of our community to continue to make this a five star restaurant.  Great food, fun, and atmosphere. Love this place!!!

ixdBtMNMeBoO-zC3gXrrWg.text: Incredible experience and ambiance - a timeless experience that takes me back to my childhood in Little Italy Chicago! The good is outstanding!
