r_0l2MNKHAKpSXj1996ByQ.text: Came here last night for my parents 50th anniversary. We were a party of 10 (6 adults, 4 kids) in Vegas for vacation and was looking for an Italian restaurant to celebrate at.  Found My Mother's House on Yelp and had a great experience all around, from the reservations, to the entertainment (yes there is a $5 per person charge but it's written on the menu and our singer was great), to the greeting by Chef Mike, and great customer service by Aunt Cheryl and the staff.  We ordered family style and ordered about 7 dishes plus 3 desserts.  The absolute highlights were the Frutti di mare (in white sauce), linguine and clams, and the shrimp scampi.  The simple house salad was also amazing...even the non salad eaters at our table were asking for more.  For the desserts, the limoncello and Saint Anthony's culpa are not to be missed.  The only downside was the desserts aren't large enough to be shared and we didn't order enough for our table as the kids were all digging in even after the scoops of ice cream from Chef Mike! Overall was a great night!

dAYnJ8AfP_MHH79wCoHgwQ.text: If I could leave negative stars, believe me I would. This restaurant boasts authentic Italian food and great prices. Well I have been more satisfied with a Marie Callenders microwave pasta dinner I bought in a rush at a gas station for $3...this food is mediocre at best and the cost is ABSOLUTELY insane for the lack of flavor and smallish portions. Also not too thrilled to find out the owner has a spotty past (i.e. felony rape conviction!?) I will never set foot in this craphole again and ESPECIALLY would not recommend your patronage if you are a female or have female children. It is a disgrace that he is even allowed to hold a business license no less be inter-mingling with women in a place of business....go waste your money at Olive Garden, at least their sub-par food is worth the price.

m-82vocy4W1rOUoD334gGw.text: Absolute best. Mike and Laura are great host. And the music is outstanding. You can go and listen to Frank Sinatra music with Mike as you're singer. He serenades your table as well

IzNL2UkqCLvrsgXD4eienw.text: We love this place! We have been 3 times and each time really enjoyable food and atmosphere. Chief Laura greats you with such warmth and don't forget Chief Michael's strolling singing. We have taken out of town guests twice ( tonight we are going to take mom from out of town) she's going to love it.  So happy to find a comfortable place to relax with amazing food

34y6oVm7lyMUvhz41oMBSg.text: Pros: GREAT FOOD!! ... GREAT SERVICE!! ... GREAT ATMOSPHERE!!! Love the garlic bread and tomato dip appetizer!!!! Nice sized portions. Our food server (Angelina?) was terrific, enthusiastic, and cared that all the food was to our liking. Never had to ask for a drink refill, which is a pet peeve when I dine out!  Best to make reservations. Easy to park.  Michael and Laura are great hosts, and chances are, one or both will greet you at your table during the course of your stay!  Cons: 1) Between appetizers and main course, dinner choices are fairly pricey - before drinks. Expect to spend $40-$50+ per person + tip. 2) NO SOUP selection(s) on the dinner menu! 3) I like the live music and their selections - but unfortunately, they play WAY too loud for such a small venue. Having a conversation at your table while the band plays is totally impossible.  Summary: If you are looking for a small out-of-the-way place with a nice atmosphere to get great Italian food (fish too!) and service, and not have to constantly ask for drink refills, this is the place! On the other hand, if you want a nice quiet place to dine and converse with a date, go on Tues, Wed, and Thurs night, when there is no live music.

GFFx2H_tnl6PjBKJm05_2g.text: I came here for my husbands work Christmas dinner. I had the best time ever. I felt right at home. The entertainment was amazing. The live music played classics from the Rat Pack and Chef Michael got everyone at each table involved. It brought the room to life. The food was very delicious. This was my first visit and will definitely not be my last.

PQq8dbt_TkKsmNONxC2SKQ.text: Mama Mia! What a great meal we had while being entertained by ago fine singer & trio. The lasagne was outstanding as was my salad. I WILL be back!

KGqOYtVahVhVgAnX_CgXcQ.text: Just tried this place. Cute restaurant with very nice hosts. Unfortunately, the food was fairly tasteless.

v0fXMwF8w2I4qKSdTspJEA.text: Amazing!!  A little gem in Vegas crazy life. We came with friends and our 2 1/2 year old.  They were so nice with her and had a high chair ready before we got there. 1qh1spRKAnUIGe7fWKTkUg.text: This is an awesome restaurant and experience.  I can not describe the portions and my glass of wine was two pours versus the normal one.  The ambiance was just as good as the food.  They played live music with class.  I felt like Frank Sinatra was live on stage.  If you are from the Midwest or East coast you will appreciate this place.  The owners actually take an interest in their business and greet the customers.  I missed that and it reminded me of home.  I loved this place I hope you will try it as it is so nice to have a Mom and Pop shop in Las Vegas that makes it feel like family that cares.  Come for the food stay for the entertainment

8glYNG_pNFN2J9gruZckyg.text: Lets start with the ultra tacky decor. This place has a nice patio area that could be made so nice to sit in, but the plastic plants and other decorations scattered everywhere inside and outside would make even your Italian Nona shake her head in disapproval.  The food is bland beyond belief, yet sometimes salty like crazy. The pasta overcooked to death, which is probably why the place is a senior citizen hub.  The meatballs were classic buffet or airplane food flavor. The marinara was bad bad bad. Of all the bad Italian food in existence in this town, this one should be rated somewhere at the very top of the "bad" list. However, I understand that the older clientele appreciates the tacky decor, the bland awful food and the overall atmosphere. They deserve to have a place of their own that caters to their likings, nothing wrong with that I guess. But if you are under 60, or had an actual Italian mother or grand mother who could cook, skip it. The owner seemed nice and friendly. He tried to replace the seafood pasta dish we sent back, but there was simply no time left (lunch break). He might be a very nice guy, but I would not give him the title of "chef" under any circumstances.

aLCEa7fbhqNnKxxTNTlo5A.text: Great food, very reasonably priced, great location for locals. Chef Michael personally greets you and follows through ensuring everything is going well. Looking for good Italian food, this is your spot.

ZHM-9kWP2CdB4tiTw_IPKw.text: Love love love this place!! They are the amazing! The food is amazing! I would recommend my mothers house to everyone I see!

giV_f8Ipv9XFWI7cXbMK3w.text: Chef M took our order...I ordered linguine and clams in white sauce. My friend said, "I'll have the same." Chef suggested mussels instead...friend said he had that the last time. Chef offered yet another unprompted alternative...What about crab?!?! Friend thought for quite some time, and said OK. At any time did Chef M mention that linguine and clams is $23 while the crab plate feeds 3 and is $80?!?! NO. Surprise at bill time!!! My dish was flavorless and linguine was so over cooked swirling around a fork was impossible as it would break into 1 inch pieces. Salad was too salty and oniony. Another friends Chicken Marsala was incredibly salty in addition to the capers. dA74W2geJnwtXhMjK5rQYw.text: We had heard great things about this place and everything they said was True and then some! What a wonderful experience. DLQcB5IqOxKyW2b3O8gF0Q.text: Where to begin... Firstly, Chef Mike truly makes you feel at home in his and his wife's restaurant. From the presentation of specials to the countless stories that he shares about performing in Vegas' younger days. My wife and I are vegan and Mike was able to accommodate us with a delicious pasta and veggie plate. My 5 other family members (meat eaters) were served big beautiful plates of food to share. We all enjoyed the experience very much. We finished with a happy birthday dessert, again, beautiful served and brought with a sparkler! Thank you for welcoming us in and treating us to such a lovely dinner.

IhcK3ksN_cuSuya-qt0hlw.text: My family and I tried this place out for the first time on a Wednesday evening. When we walked in, we were greeted with warmth and with the sounds of a live band. Apparently the band only plays 2 nights per week; we just got lucky that we arrived on one of those nights because the music was outstanding. Now the food...it was outstanding. Our table had a mixture of seafood, polenta, and pasta - it was all very good. Also, did I mention that their bread and sauce was good? Well, it was outstanding!!! They had an excellent wine selection and the service was beyond expectations. I recommend this place to all local residents to include anyone visiting Las Vegas. The food is good 24/7, but if you can plan it, try to visit them on one of the live music nights. Recommend making reservations too because everyone knows this place rocks! Thanks for the wonderful experience...and thanks for your support to the military!

IdPF2RCKbUvhwRPiy9i3gA.text: Went to My Mother's House a few weeks ago and had a wonderful time. Great food and entertainment. We made a reservation approximately one month in advance to take some very special friends for a fun evening. It was a disaster, very obvious they had over-booked for the evening. The first issue was we were seated at a table with wobbly folding chairs in the corner with a clear view of where the cooks were preparing meals and the main passage way for the waiters. We were then told by our waiter (Franco) that he did not want to "rush" us but, we needed to order prior to a large party's order was put in. To me that is clearly being rushed. We did place our order as requested. We were served an appetizer, drinks and three baskets of bread while a large party which was seated 45 minutes after us were served their meal while we continued to wait. When asking our waiter about our meal his response was "I asked you to get your order in". We had now been waiting 1 1/2 hour and no sign of meals. At that point we asked for our drink and appetizer check to leave. We were very disappointed and not to mention embarrassed because of wanting to treat our friends to a special evening. Our advice to the owners would be not to book patrons that they are unable to accommodate. Needless to say "My Mother's House" will be marked off our list to dine or recommend.

AnsI7bvB929jbmuURNpfxw.text: Had a delicious meal, Fruta Del Mar, which was the special of the day.  Clams, crab, mussels & shrimp over linguini.  Delicious, served with garlic toast.  Was served complimentary antipasto and a light Salad before the entree came.  Service and ambiance all excellent.  Pianist sang for an extra nice touch. Truly felt like an honored guest. Definitely will go back.

thy94WYatK4RWYHWZ4J5Sw.text: Went to Las Vegas this weekend and we found this gem on yelp.  Unfortunately, we went there on a Sunday night and did not get to see the Rat Pack show.  Chef Mike (owner) and his partner Laura, treated our party like family.  I asked Chef Mike to bring us some great food.  He asked us what kind of food we liked and the rest was history.  Several dishes came family style.  The Eggplant and the Ravioli plate were our favorites, but everything was great.  Chef Mike even entertained us with a song.  We ended up closing the place down, because we were having so much fun.  Save room for dessert.  We didn't, but we ate it any way.  You leave stuffed with great food and memories of a good time.  We will be back!

kYp_IKhMBnzN_2xgDWBQ6g.text: I took the family here for dinner right before Christmas and we had a ball. My 5 and 7 yo boys got to call Santa right from our table. The service was great. The family style entree we ordered was delicious and the live music was awesome. Highly recommend!

zbq_2tUCTXIjt9s8e7i53w.text: Yes!  Yes! Yes! The best, most exciting and enjoyable restaurant in Las Vegas!   From the very entertaining Chef Mike & vivacious Laura, they have created an energetic place that has no equal!   The wait staff are all delightful and helpful.  The food is excellent,  very tasty and plentiful.   Mike & Laura have done a great job of creating a world class, high energy, warm place that is an experience locals and out of town visitors are going to enjoy. Now if that's the Italian way then it's all good, Ehh! The garlic bred was good though. So all in all I paid $43.00 for some glorified Mac n Cheese and a very blah salad. It's safe to say I won't give them another chance. Thank you for your time

z3O0g7yugIAKZv-kQvy5Vw.text: This was the best experience we have had in a long time! The staff was amazing, the food was amazing and the atmosphere was amazing! Definitely a hidden Vegas treasure! We will be back soon

6dLS8u1fOHCaT5JLqI6xOw.text: This place is AMAZING! The food is superb!  The Neapolitan salad is delicious, the pasta dishes are like Mama used to make and the Tiramisu is a must! The atmosphere is great from the design and decor to the live band! Spend a few hours with Chef Michael Leonetti and his family, you won't regret it!!!! We spent our 15th Wedding Anniversary with them and will be visiting again soon!

aS3Qa85DJIaMXXpoRtweDA.text: This was our third time dining at My Mother's House.  Everyone at our table agrees that the food is ok (we are a large group). We first was introduced to the restaurant and enjoyed the entertainment however tonight was subpar. The owners are nice however don't know if we will visit again.

IYWe8pl1uMKCidSPq0yolg.text: Yelp sent us here!  The good was so good!  Best lasagna I have ever had.  Husband had polenta which he said was very good.  We were just passing through, but I will go again if we are in the area.  Chef and his wife were very friendly and funny.  It's definitely relaxed dining and no one is in a hurry.

DamNNxiDXCdwkGVqW26S0A.text: Five star atmosphere, entertainment and wonderful hosts but not sure what happened with food the night we were there.  Ordered Chicken Piccata, received a small piece of poached chicken breast and zucchini in an overly lemon sauce laden with Olives. Hello! What happened to the Capers? I returned the dish and decided to go with Chicken Marsala. This, too was nothing like I'd ever seen resembling the dish. I received an over cooked, tough heavily breaded chicken cutlet hardly with a sauce not resembling Marsala. I've never even seen Chicken Marsala with a heavily fried Chicken Cutlet. The cutlet could have been served with a variety of sauces vis-a-vis Cacciatore, Parmigiana. In fairness the salad greens they served...greens only, no tomatoes, but with a hint of red onion did have a delicious dressing. Three of the people at my table left their food and and said their dishes were mediocre. One of those customers was an  accredited chef. So I am not alone in my thoughts. I will return to the restaurant for the hospitality and entertainment but will eat sparingly. Our host did mention he had two new chefs. Perhaps they were having an off night!

4ncaHFMVBS7S5ZCWnOf13A.text: My mom and I went on a recommendation from several different friends and we are SO happy we did! First of all, they are constantly busy, so call to make sure you can get a table. We got into one of the last tables and enjoyed live music during dinner. We felt that prices were very reasonable for how quality the food was and how HUGE the portions are. We split a pasta and salad and had more leftover. We also had desserts (it would be a crime if you didn't). We were welcomed with open arms and talked to throughout the whole meal, which made us feel like family. Our waitress Kris, was very kind and super knowledgeable about the menu. This place is a gem in the Vegas local community. It's nice to have dinner and entertainment without going near the strip or Fremont. The only downfall is that this place is way too close to my house; they're never going to see the end of me! Thank you so much! We will be back very soon.

XhGPMliSISbaTSFjl8MItw.text: Way overpriced for microwaved food!!!!!!!!! The desserts are not home made!!!!! My girlfriend and I were recommended this restaurant so we decided to go on our next visit to Vegas. After 5 minutes of sitting down, a busboy came by for water, and he did not look happy at all. The next time he came by we had a little conversation, and some more on the next few times he refilled our waters.  Every single pasta serving is microwaved, and so is the lasagna!!!! No wonder it was pretty awful. Tasted boiled. Wish I asked him before I ordered it. He told me he saw the cooks dropping food on the floor and still tossing it in the pan, trying to justify it saying that "whatever dirt would get cleaned out by the frying oil"!!! The pasta sides are absolutely disgusting, super overcooked and obviously microwaved. They have no clue what "al dente" means since they cook it in the morning or the day before and microwave it and quickly boil it before serving. Now to the very best part. The owner keeps bragging about his food, his rating etc. Obviously he does about his desserts too. I ordered a tiramisu and my girlfriend got a st Anthony's cup. They are all pre-made, the tiramisu comes in boxes and they cut it in the kitchen in tiny slivers, and st Anthony's cup and limoncello desserts are all bought in and just unwrapped and served!!! How can you lie about the best tiramisu and other desserts saying it's your grandma's recipe when it's bought in containers??????? I'd have been happier to just eat it and not being lied to since it's not that bad, but all that bragging and lying is totally unnecessary!!!  We also found out that another bus boy named a Eric and a couple other people make the salads (which are comped before your meal arrives) without washing their hands!!!! How sick is that??? Newsflash for you, so-called 4.8 rating restaurant , it's rule number 1 in food handling to instruct your employees to wash their hands every single time they handle food!!!!!!! Will never eat there again, wish we didn't listen to my aunt to go try this two-bit restaurant

fxzCXyUG73jpr6yfiYlyqQ.text: Had an absolutely fantastic experience! Food was great and the service and people were even better! Definitely coming back :)

MpE0dTXp2SHwzKWjfe7s0Q.text: I don't even know where to start! As soon as we walked in we got greeted by the owners who are as sweet as can be and they brought out the "Santa phone" for my daughter who was so happy. They gave her a huge lollipop per "Santa" request and ice cream when she finished her dinner. Then we were surprised that the owner was also one the performers with so much talent might I add. Total old school Italian man who loves his restaurant, takes so much pride and it shows. Now the food was delicious be patient because it takes a while but well worth the LARGE portions. Homemade Italian food and great desserts. Our experience beginning to end was amazing.

nYaPMeRSIm2nkkPj8n4d6g.text: This place is amazingly awesome,great service.the owner is very nice and polite. The food is amazing, the entertainment is great as well.i would definitely recomend this place,but be sure to make  reservations.

4f4_D5s7jmt0XsIeTh2yYw.text: Had a phenomenal birthday with the family at "My Mother's House". Most definitely one I will never forget. I am already raving to my friends about the amazing service, exceptional food, and outstanding performances. Karey was #1 - 5 star service!!!!!   Hope to see you all soon.

NbqdbBL02ooXjHAKImEabg.text: The atmosphere here was great! Very personable and felt just like back east. The stories Chef Mike would tell reminded me of home. They have entertainment on Fri-Sun. I wish it weren't so loud though, was hard to have a conversation and for the waiter to hear what we were ordering. I would say it's cramped in there. The table next to us had their chairs touching ours and it was almost impossible to get out without everyone having to get up. The antipasto was amazing! The roasted red peppers had such a great flavor! I ordered a chocolate egg cream, which I used to get all time in NY so I was very excited to see it on the menu. It was lacking flavor. Definitely needed more chocolate, and was a little watered down. A few tweaks and it could be just as good as the diners back home! We had a large party with us and my parents were sold on the brisket, that they claimed was so tender you could cut it with a spoon, or it's on the house. It was in fact very tender. However, the brown gravy served with it was not great, and the canned green beans were too mushy. Also, I don't believe macaroni is a good choice to serve with this dish. The brown gravy and sauce don't go together. I had ordered the shrimp Alfredo. When it was brought to me the waiter had given me shrimp scampi. He apologized and said it would be out soon. I'm not even joking when I say that my Alfredo was in front of me in 2 minutes! Most people would be very happy for that, however that is too soon to put together a dish. The sauce was watery, and I'm not sure if it's because it was rushed or if that's how it's happy served. Was also lacking A LOT of flavor. Needed salt, and much more cheese. To be honest it tasted like jar sauce. My boyfriend had ordered the spaghetti and crab, which Chef Mike made it seem like it was angel hair with jumbo lump crab meat and crab sauce on top. When he came to our table to ask what we ordered he yelled back to the kitchen and told them to scoop extra crab on top, which we thought was very generous. Well.... when my boyfriend received his dish, it was not how we expected. Not like how he's used to getting back in Philly. There was a small crab on top and to my unbelievable shock, the 'jumbo lump crab' meat that was scooped on top, was imitation crab. Yes. Imitation crab. He thought it was pieces of rigatoni on top so he made me taste it (I'm a chef and food reviewer so I know my stuff very very well) I was floored that they would advertise spaghetti and crab, no less charge $30 something dollars for it, and not even give real crab?? Everything was lacking flavor, the people who work there were very nice, but food wise, it just wasn't for me. Another thing that we noticed, there was a family of Asians at a table eating, and Chef Mike kept saying how he was craving egg rolls and wonton soup, then sang a song about Chinese food to that family of Asians. I thought that was a little weird. There was also a mother and daughter that were reunited after 47 years after the mother had given her daughter up. He made a joke how the mom owes her 47 Christmas gifts. Little things like that I don't think are appropriate to say, even if you are joking around.

5xFzO_yD49Cs9ciIOaSg4g.text: #1 Make a reservation i don't think they accept walk-ins! Decent size restaurant but they can fill up quick. Also very elegant and have an our door area. You'll feel like you just walked into an authentic Italian restaurant (From New York). Big loud welcome from the owners. He greets many guests and enjoys having conversations with the tables. On certain days live music.   I recommend coming to this place with 3+ people. The portions are family style so for the price of each dish you might only end up with 1-2 entrees depending on the number of people. Dishes start from $25+. Don't let that scare you they are very generous with portion sizes. Garlic bread (AMAZING, don't eat too much before food) and antipasti salad served with most dishes as an appetizer. Overall it was a nice night out. However I would plan on coming with a larger party than 2 if we went again because of the portion sizes.   Ordered the chicken  Parmesan and linguine with a meat sauce. Chicken Parm was great and it was a large thick piece. The pasta is served under the chicken in a large bowl which we didn't know so I would have not got the meat sauce if I knew that was the case and would have rather tried their red sauce instead. Cannoli cream was too rich for me but if you love cannolis then you might enjoy this.

F63_uZwbTF6FgsbP69rgmQ.text: My husband and I had an early dinner at this charming restaurant in a neighborhood so unexpected.  This is the kind of place I've tried to find since we relocated to Las Vegas a year ago.  Family owned and served with pride.  This is Authentic Italian cuisine and is cooked with such a heart and soul using only the freshest of seafood and sauces all homemade with family Inherited traditional recipes.  The family serving is enough for 5 people.  Welcoming and friendly attentive staff.  We can't wait to go back.

jkD9902xj07vAM8a33l4pg.text: The ambiance and good spirited nature of the entire crew makes this restaurant one of the best places in town! The food is great and the hosts really make you feel at home. Make sure to attend on Wednesday, Friday, or Saturday so you can see the show, too. The food was great and we really enjoyed ourselves. There is an entertainment charge for $5 per person, but the table is yours the entire evening!

fgfzFIcCD25j6w7WixYwmg.text: Little Italian spot, BIG personality! We happened upon this gem while searching for something new to try for my husband's bday dinner. SCORE!  It's not huge, it's a small intimate dining room. You can go as casual or fancy as you please. The food was awesome, rivaling our Italian Grandma's specialities and the service was warm and welcoming. The owners were stopping by and chatting with everyone- lots of laughter and chumming it up.   Lots of items served family style. We ordered a small portion and took home a foil try (seriously). The tiramisu (delightfully described my the owner) was the best I've ever had. We will definitely be back on a Wednesday, Friday or Saturday night so we can catch the Rat Pack act. We were advised to make a reset for one of those nights, usually a packed room!

UpOMZsUISexG5DQBOsnRUQ.text: I didn't have a reservation, make sure to make one because this place is busy.  I ordered dessert takeout from the hostess Laura(who was awesome) and had great service, better food and cute atmosphere.

Zd6xbCMcOEn6zTsR5p_nQg.text: This place is cute and has lots of charm.  The chicken parmesan served on spaghetti was good. The garlic bread with dipping marinara is very tasty. The owners are nice... Michael is very entertaining and can really belt out the classics. His family stories are endearing. Definitely take your family and friends to enjoy this supper club atmosphere. We'll be back... look at how cute their outside patio is... looking forward to Spring.

photos.caption: Photo of My Mother's House Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mike Leonetti and his bandmates played oldschool classics.

suyQf5KnEg14sc4GNRzDkQ.text: What a great dining experience tucked away in the Sun City community. Dishes are amazing, our main course was the Frutti De Mare...this awesome and what a presentation. Enough for 4 with pasta, also had some outstanding desserts (Lemon Chello ) which everything is homemade here! Thanks Chef Mike and Aunt Cheryl...we will be back :)

lznSiCSxqEVa-ZAGMaM6cA.text: True Mom & Pop shop (or maybe brother sister?), where they make you feel like you are at their home!  And the food is to die for!  They do not make their own pasta, but if you have ever made fresh pasta, you know how long that takes.  In restaurant terms, add 5 bucks to the price of the meal :-)  I had the chicken Marsala: great homemade sauce with nice beefy mushrooms, and THE MOST TENDER CHICKEN I have ever had in a Marsala.  I asked the chef for the secret and he gave it to me ...  I am not gonna share it.  Go and ask yourself :-)  Brilliant!  Meatballs?  Homemade and not simply hamburger rolled into a ball.  Clearly a family recipe developed over generations.  Sausage?  Don't get me started!  One small secret: he grinds fresh fennel into almost a powder do you don't get the annoying BANG of 2 bits of full fennel in one bite.  I loved the bolognese as well, some of the best I have ever had!  Once again, clearly a recipe that has been developed over generations.  When it comes to dessert, please ask for what is made in house, like the Tiramisu, or the lemoncello ice.  The Tiramisu was fantastic, but the lemoncello did not make it home somehow.  I could swear I watched her put it in the box for all the to-go food I got, but somehow it was not there when I got home.  So sad :-(  BEST PART?  They deliver!!!!!!  I think I might have an account with these guys by the end of it all :-)

PX0f9QHqNSj8mZB_ntgjJQ.text: chef laura you are miss  representing yourself. i have done extensive research on your culinary experience. you are not a chef!!!! should have known.  the food was salty . would have been happier if i went to  the drive through and supper sized it, n saved me the money. over priced crap. chef laura is about 100 years old , probably time to throw in the towel and retire.   chef laura where did you go to culinary school?  if you are a chef,  i would like to "find" the school since you conviently did not answer my question.

fFKH_JLOa8B8dw-_PD2Dgg.text: That was a True Vegas experience! (at least the way I imagined it must have been)  You walk in not knowing what to expect and they gradually break down your defenses until you are begging for seconds on the ( I think they called it gabba goul) ham, and an encore of the Zinga Zinga song.  The bandleader, also the head chef, Michael was magical.  Incredible voice and magnificent drummer.  And the sauce was absolutely the best in town. They call it the last remaining "supper club" and we had a blast.    Can't wait til we do it again!

NP-BDhVfISXKF782EeprIw.text: This place is great! Friendliest group of people you will ever meet work here. Just as good as any Italian food you will find on the Strip. Delicious

S44kB9XhQmm2Mj9f1Px_Uw.text: My wife, daughter, and I decided to try this out after seeing all the great reviews. We were happy we did. The service was top notch from the start. Cheryl and Sal were very friendly and took care of us without hesitation. They were especially great with our 1 year old daughter! Chef Mike came to greet us at our table to tell us the night's special, who then gave my daughter a huge free lollipop and free garlic bread basket for coming in. The garlic bread was great and came with a bolognese dipping sauce that was fantastic! My wife ordered the chicken piccata and I had the linguine with clams. The main dishes were very good and they come in generous portions. 2 lbs of linguine and 1/2 lb of clams! I had enough to bring home for another meal. This place was so great that they made a bowl of penne for my daughter and gave her a bowl of ice cream, no charge! With such great service, we left a generous tip! This place is fantastic and makes you feel like family the moment you step in! My family will be back soon!

87Tcj3hzJ4_juUB_GPKqtg.text: You want The Best East coast Italian food ever ?? Come see Chef Mike !! Home away Home  Prices are fair and Uncle Dylan is the best server ever!!! I

H2ZFCLJca5TNqjcXa1hT5w.text: This was our first visit. The entertainment and atmosphere was fun.  My Greek style mussels were excellent. Unfortunately, my wife's crab diablo dish was burnt and the sauce was mostly bread.  She could barely taste the crab, and it was too salty.

Dining here felt like a celebration, the atmosphere is fabulous!

Cb4xXEh3nQx_dlcEGwP7GQ.text: This is one of the greatest Italian restaurants I have been to! When we first got there we weren't sure what to expect because the outside decor wasn't too spectacular. Once we walked in we were amazed! The place was very nice, clean, and loved the decor. I recommend making a reservation because we went on a Saturday and all the tables were reserved, luckily we were there 2 hours before the reservation. We got some very great bread as an appetizer. Our waiter was soooo nice, really helped us as to it being our first time there. The family portions were huge! Great flavor we were able to feed 4 people with two plates of the family size (lots of leftovers). Great family owned restaurant, a must try!

They  made my lady and I feel like we had been there a million times.  We also had enough food to take home for memories.  All this for a more than reasonable price. Don't hesitate, go there,  you will thank us.

ylJTuFgvk2nTRPX3Vizzgg.text: What an amazing experience.   I say experience because that's exactly what it was.   My husband and I took our kids, one is under two and her brother is almost four.  They both had the best time.  They loved the live music and had a great time dancing.   The food was the best I've ever had.   When I first walked in I immediately had a smile on my face. We had the rigatoni with meatballs and sausage, the ravioli, the chicken Alfredo and the house specialty pot roast. All were to die for. sjbrPPG4xok8aXyvsMM5Vw.text: This place is a GRAND SLAM. Such a fun place. Great ambiance. Love it that Mike the owner interacts with guests and makes you feel AT HOME. ZK2PBdq995Eoa0JM8pAEBQ.text: I would give more stars if I could!  Their customer service is beyond amazing.  Better than those restaurants in the Bellagio.  From the moment I made the reservation to the time we walked out the door.  To which the server was holding open for us.  They really do make you feel like family. rqtNJQa24w31QKPx39Xlmg.text: stopped by on the whim after a great work out at 24 hour fitness across the street. THEY HAVE LIVE SWING MUSIC!!!!!!! and the service is excellent.... the owner was singing for the crowd and greeted each guest w love  Trying to get through a rough week and i'm so happy that we decided to stop by. SO MUCH LOVE HERE. BLUEBERRY CHEESECAKE ON THE HOUSE, will send all friends and family. Great place

photos.caption: Photo of My Mother's House Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g9J2TxIt46coC6nJRcB7Aw.text: Chefs Michael and Laura will make you welcome as soon as you arrive, and it just keeps getting better. My wife Laura has been here four times, me only twice, but both times soooo good. Classic Italian family cooking, great portions, and so tasty. And if you are lucky chef Michael will sing for you! We had the gnocchi with meatballs in the fabulous red sauce, the frutti di mare, and the lasagna. All were amazing. Also recommend the CMS red wine.  Come hungry and leave happy.

photos.caption: Photo of My Mother's House Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_0ErflqVtS0nbzz1uGtE0A.text: Heard about My Mother's House from my son and his wife, so when my Canadian cousins came to town I had to take them to this very special place off the strip.  What a fun experience it was, so old Las Vegas! We all enjoyed the music immensely and Mike was a wonderful host and great entertainer!   The food was delicious especially the brisket and tempura cauliflower...loved everything about My Mother's House and will definitely recommend this place to others and will come back again, and again.  Thank you for the great local experience!

RRnLwDeGgCj8Bw-dmkKOng.text: Frutti Di Mare for 2 is big enough for 4 and out of this world.  What a charming spot with nice patio seating.   I would be back over and over.

photos.caption: Photo of My Mother's House Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1KcqML6qvQepdPxfOjgQHA.text: Sausage was delicious! Very noisey on saturday night and they charged a $5.00 charge for loud entertainment. Food was warm at best. You can't carry on a conversation with a band with amps blasting away. The waitress was very good! All portions of food was family style.

cTabjxiWUMveQw5fGK29mg.text: Mike and Laura are incredibly hospitable. They made us feel like family. Food is delicious. Entertainment is fun and lively. And our server, Aunt Doris was attentive and friendly. Everyone there was, truly. We had a perfect evening. Thank you so much for making our Mother's Day dinner happy & memorable.

kr-cephmGfAdlJjIAN1CiA.text: OMG! What a place! I went to My Mother's House for the 1st time yesterday after seeing it advertised on TV (I live 10 mins away and had no idea this restaurant even existed) and I have to say I felt like I was back in NY again with the relatives. Michael, Laura and Cheryl were so personable and made my visit really special.  I ordered the Chicken Sinatra and it was delicious! The sauce was to die for with the garlic bread. I am now a big fan and will come back again and again. Thank you Michael, Laura and Cheryl!!!

QfJjbEpp5i3SSfIS4brgfg.text: Such a fun and amazingly happy place! The food is AMAZING!!!!! Never had suck a tight community. Highly recommend to come tot his place! Best home made Italian food!

n1pHBVmsj8Ozt9tXdjW9UQ.text: Must go! Best entertainment, old Vegas is back. Great food, fun time everyone is welcomed by the owners - really feels like being at your Mother's house.

1cxuzfLTFIegY9hAlycWJA.text: Very good food large portion and personable service. High price point and they charge $5 to split the entree. Piano player too loud for the size of the venue.

5uLtowYBZzFGTWjXXe614Q.text: This restaurant was the best.  It brought back the old school Italian vibe with the best live performances.  It had the PaZazz!

i6JS5r6OK8GL9oL2Ed0c4g.text: My mom and I went here for lunch we just live right around the corner. Lunch menus a bit small with just sandwiches except they did have rigatoni and meatballs for the special which my mom got. I got a meatball sandwich which came with some pasta. Both were excellent! The waitress was super friendly as soon as you step in here you feel like you're part of the family. The waitress told me that the owner sings and we just missed him singing. He came over to our table with his guitar and sang to my 93-year-old mom. That made my day! He's a great singer and  musician, that was so nice of him to do that. Super friendly guy that's the chef as well. I checked out the dinner menu and I really want to come back for dinner. It gets super busy at dinner time so you have to make a reservation. I'll be back for sure

L6KzrJ3l7uJMqmapfI95Ng.text: WOW!!!!!! Three of us here and three amazing dishes - Gnocchi, Chicken Marsala, Chicken Piccata. Exceptional sauces, flavors, portions. Couldn't even finish. Oh, and the wine!! Great price on a spectacular Sokol Blosser Evolution Pinot Noir. Then...dessert!!! Homemade in-house Spumoni and a Tiramisu beyond belief. And the chef even visited our table. I love that!!!

WAZFbCU7MALP2Meu4kjV3Q.text: This was a very good place. I am so happy we stumbled upon it tonight! Owners and waitresses were top notch! Thank you for an awesome dinner and making my daughter so happy. We will be back.

8K3_zVJharUbwJMpKvz_nQ.text: Pretty much knew I'd like the food based on the reviews and name of the restaurant..But it was better than I expected + the service and friendliness was out of the world great..we had the rigatoni with meatballs and sausage..also the ribeye..nice sized portions and very tasty..

_rA8WDEzxAB8A0lH5HCBhg.text: We came here tonight for a birthday party. We don't live far from here, but have never noticed this place. I don't even know where to begin... The service is amazing!! It's really like being at your Mothers house. Whatever you need is taken care of before you realize you need it. The food- so delicious!! I highly recommend this place!

_dlBcRh9sDDCNLp06j7IBw.text: Probably the best Italian restaurant in all of Las Vegas.  Making it even more enjoyment was show night.  Short review because all the other reviews that present how outstanding this restaurant is, are spot on!

oKzTyMuGHo0q4o8Hu7GMgg.text: My son and I had the best experience! The music, the soup, the entree. . . delicious! We had personal service given only by people who love their job.

h2FJ3p99RaQ3H3lnW5YRCA.text: I can't begin to tell you how impressed we were tonight when we stumbled upon this gem of a restaurant on our first night in Las Vegas! Everybody there was so awesome and there was music and piano and singing and the food was terrific! The ambience it self was non-parallel.  We are really lucky that we went there on a Monday night because I can see that they really get rockin in there! That is our new favorite Italian restaurant :-)

ajcr6FDoQiU5JEKlhoW4Og.text: This is a hidden gem! If you haven't been, you need to go. Great food, singing/entertainment, and atmosphere. We will be regulars here for sure. Thank you Mike, Laura, and My Mother's House family! You are all amazing! :)

BzxJjOuxnwML5CUEhGrO0g.text: My new favorite resturant!!!!  Excellent food, entertainment, and memories of my big Italian family.  Nobody just eats and leaves.   Everybody is family.........conversation, lots of hugs and kisses.   Enjoyed the experience.  Hats off to chef Michael and his wonderful staff.

sBhJc1s_DP_Bmj8QqKE5hg.text: Finally got to my mother's house and loved it! A beautiful quaint Italian restaurant in Sun city. They had a piano player, which I enjoyed very much. Laura and Michael were very friendly and our server Scott was fantastic! We got a seafood linguini dish that was delicious and split between 3 of us with a ton of leftovers! We finished off with blueberry cheesecake that I swore I didn't have room for but I had no problem indulging in it!

fF9TH7agJuIGAxohnMkl5w.text: Since its debut in Sun City Summerlin this little place has proven that good food served in a pleasant room can attract a loyal following. Many others have commended on the food and ambience so I'd like to say a word about an aspect that I believe detracts from a truly enjoyable evening. Specifically, the noise level. Overpowering noise from bands that can virtually blow you out of your seat. We were guests at a wedding related event last Saturday evening and had to contend with music so loud it was difficult to carry on a conversation with the person sitting across the table. We had heard that the restaurant was noisy but weren't prepared for what was essentially an orchestra in such a small room. Our understanding is that music is not featured every evening so if we return it will definitely be on a night that it is absent. Otherwise, MMH does not disappoint and is definitely worth a visit.

GbqKPI4Pf5rqDcp8b7Br6A.text: Sorry but they didn't have a four-and-a-half star rating. That's how I would rate it. Between 90 seconds and two minutes we had water and menus at the table.  They brought a small dish of antipasto. I mixed that with the salad they brought. The salad had lettuce and sweet white onions. When mixed with the antipasto the dressings mixed so well I could have just had that for dinner. The taste of the combined salads was past great. I had the aunt Carmela  dish with linguine. That dish had meatballs, sausage, and eggplant parmigiana to go with the linguine. The taste of each item in the dish was fantastic. This place will be one reason to get excited about returning to Vegas. Thank you to the entire staff.  On a side note. Very new restaurant I think you're going to need reservations within 30 days. When we left it was packed.

amxNi9YPoStNoImkD_QQ4Q.text: The name of this restaurant is perfect!!! It's food prepared with LOVE and the hospitality of "loving family" surrounds you!! The owners and all the staff (also family) are truly delightful!! Being a local, I almost don't want to rave about this place but that would be selfish . It's a wonderful Italian experience!!! Thank you!!!

24uMr6NaHlDrVRFAFCpW3A.text: We love this place!! The vibe is great, the staff is wonderful and fun. We love the food and the entertainment. It's a hidden gem in our city!

DXWKLbx76XdkwXrlBDS7yw.text: Good food  fun atmosphere! Reminded me of my Grandma's place! I love the entertainment and all the stories! We have been a few times and will continue to be back!

-XG3vjR2sxj_rsqrLE_Ujg.text: This was by far one of the best Italian dining experiences we have had in Las Vegas!  The ambiance is lovely, warm, and relaxing. The quality of the food is superb.  The owner is charming and engages each guest.  A very definite A+.
